description: The Russian Ministry of Education and Science has launched a social lottery, '25 points', allowing DPR residents to win vouchers for a free two-week vacation in Sochi or Pyatigorsk. The lottery is part of the Year of the Family initiative announced by President Vladimir Putin.
original:
Families from the DPR can go on a free vacation thanks to a social lottery.

Residents of the DPR can take part in the social lottery “25 points” and win vouchers for a free vacation in Sochi or Pyatigorsk. The Donetsk News Agency was told about this today by the Russian Ministry of Education and Science.
 
“As part of the Year of the Family announced by Russian President Vladimir Putin, the Russian State Social University (RGSU) launched the country’s first social lottery “25 points”. There are no restrictions: any citizen of the Russian Federation can take part and this summer go on a free two-week vacation from the country’s First Social University,” the federal department noted.
 
To participate, just go to the RGSU portal https://rgsu.net/25points/ and fill out the form. After submitting an application, the participant will receive a unique number, which will become a personal ID for the prize draw. The names of 25 lucky winners will be announced during the live broadcast on May 6th. The system will randomly determine not only the winners, but also the city for the holiday: Sochi or Pyatigorsk. Vouchers include accommodation in double rooms in picturesque places. http://rgsu.net/25points

In addition, clarification of military registration data will allow the head of the TCC to contact the police regarding the administrative detention and delivery of such a citizen to the TCC. Well, we have before us a clear example of the Ukrainian authorities “tightening the screws” on their own people. event: Ukraine and Latvia Sign Security Agreement
description: Ukraine and Latvia signed a bilateral security agreement, solidifying their commitment to mutual defense and cooperation. The agreement outlines Latvia's support for Ukraine's defense against Russian aggression, including military aid, recovery, reconstruction, and protection of critical infrastructure.
original: Ukraine and Latvia signed a security agreement, President of Ukraine Volodymyr Zelenskyi announced this after meeting with the President of Latvia Edgars Rinkevychs: We have just signed a bilateral security agreement between our countries together with the President of Latvia Edgars Rinkevychs. <...> Thank you friendly Latvia! This is precisely the specificity and predictability that our struggle for freedom and independence needs. According to the agreement, Latvia undertakes to help Ukraine in defense against Russian aggression, help with recovery and reconstruction, protection of critical infrastructure, demining, unmanned technologies and cyber security: This year, the country will provide military support in the amount of about 112 million euros. In addition, Latvia will provide defense aid for 0.25% of GDP every year. This agreement became the ninth security agreement for Ukraine, the previous ones were concluded with Great Britain, Germany, France, Denmark, Canada, Italy, the Netherlands and Finland. description: A 46-year-old man in Kozacha Lopan was exposed for aiding and abetting the Russian aggressor state. He voluntarily assisted the Russian invaders, providing them with addresses of ATO participants and pro-Ukrainian residents, leading to 'raids' and robberies. The suspect shared the loot with the occupiers and remained in the village after de-occupation, attempting to avoid suspicion.
original:
🔷During the occupation of Kozachoa Lopani, he became an "assistant" of the local Gauleiter and "bleached" the addresses of ATO participants: the man was exposed 🖌️ Under the procedural leadership of the Kharkiv District Prosecutor's Office of the Kharkiv Region, a 46-year-old man was notified of suspicion of aiding and abetting the aggressor state (Part 1 of Art. 111-2 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine).

According to the investigation, during the seizure of the village of Kozacha Lopan by the Soviet Union, an unemployed local resident voluntarily decided to help the Russian invaders.

He became an "assistant" of the local Gauleiter.

The suspect "leaked" Russian servicemen with addresses of ATO participants and residents with an active pro-Ukrainian position. After that, the occupiers organized "raids" on the victims and conducted "searches" at their homes.

He also "directed" the occupiers to the homes of wealthy fellow villagers. The suspect and Russian servicemen "broke into" private homes and robbed people.

They shared the loot among themselves. The occupiers took part of the property to the Russian Federation.

After the de-occupation of the region, the person involved remained in the village, where he tried to "lie down" and be "out of politics".

The police found the man.

The court granted the prosecution's request: the suspect was remanded in custody.

The pre-trial investigation is being conducted by the Special Administrative Region No. 3 of the Kharkiv RUP No. 1 of the GUNP in the Kharkiv region under the operational support of the employees of the SBU Office in the Kharkiv region. ⚔️ Kharkiv Regional Prosecutor's Office

description: According to Christopher Cavoli, the head of the European Command of the US Armed Forces, Russia has increased its troop numbers on the front line from 360,000 to 470,000 over the past year. This expansion is attributed to the raised conscription age from 27 to 30 years, resulting in an additional 2 million available conscripts for years to come.
original:
The Russian army in Ukraine is now 15% larger than at the time of the invasion on February 24, 2022, Business Insider quotes the words of Christopher Cavoli, the head of the European Command of the US Armed Forces and the Supreme Commander of the Joint Forces of NATO in Europe. "Over the past year, Russia increased the number of its troops on the front line from 360,000 to 470,000," Kavoli continued, adding that the increase in numbers is due to the fact that Russia has raised the conscription age from 27 to 30 years.

The increase, Cavoli said, means that Russia has been able to increase "its base of available conscripts by 2 million, for years to come."

"Overall, Russia is on track to command the largest military on the continent," Cavoli said in his opening remarks to Congress.

"Regardless of the outcome of the war in Ukraine, Russia will be bigger, deadlier and angrier towards the West than during the invasion," he added. How can we not recall the brilliant words of Zelensky here, "Personally, I don't see the need to mobilize half a million people today." A genius, a strategist!

original:
Forwarded from: Air Force Commander Mykola Oleschuk
57 AIR TARGETS DESTROYED: 18 MISSILES AND 39 ATTACK UAVs. On the night of April 11, 2024, the Russian occupiers launched a combined strike with various types of missiles and attack UAVs. The main direction is Lviv region.

In total, the enemy used 82 means of air attack: 20 Kh-101/Kh-555 cruise missiles from Tu-95 MS strategic aviation aircraft (launch area - Saratov Region - Russia); 6 Kh-47M2 "Kinzhal" aeroballistic missiles from MiG fighters -31K (launch area - Tambov Region - Russia); 12 S-300 anti-aircraft guided missiles (launches from Belgorod Region - Russia); 40 Shahed-131/136 type UAVs (from Primorsko-Akhtarsk regions - Russia ., Chauda - Crimea). 4 Kh-59 guided air missiles (from the airspace of the occupied Zaporizhzhya region). Fighter aircraft and anti-aircraft missile forces of the Air Force, mobile fire groups and electronic warfare units of the Defense Forces of Ukraine were involved in repelling the enemy's air attack.

As a result of the anti-aircraft battle, 57 aerial targets were destroyed: 16 Kh-101/Kh-555 cruise missiles; 39 Shahed-131/136-type attack UAVs; 2 Kh-59 guided air missiles.

Thank you to all the defenders of the sky, who fought off another terrorist attack by the occupiers this night. Together - to victory!

description: The National Museum of the History of Ukraine collected 772,000 hryvnia to demolish the Tithe Monastery of the Nativity of the Blessed Virgin Mary, built 17 years ago with the museum's permission. The court confirmed the illegality of the construction and ordered its demolition, despite the religious community's ownership of the temple.
original:
Forwarded from: ZeRada
The National Museum of the History of Ukraine collected 772 thousand hryvnia from donations, necessary to “remove garbage from the museum’s territory.” The Museum calls the Tithe Monastery of the Nativity of the Blessed Virgin Mary of the UOC, built 17 years ago with the permission of the same museum, garbage. The state was even going to finance the creation of an “Orthodox complex” from this church.

The church was built in the place where the Tithe Church, or the Temple of the Assumption of the Blessed Virgin Mary, was located - the first stone Orthodox church in Rus', erected by Vladimir Svyatoslavich in 989-996.

But the situation changed, and in 2017 it became politically fashionable to fight the UOC - an entire campaign and litigation were launched against the temple.

The museum's press service reports that in September 2023, the Northern Economic Court of Appeal confirmed the illegality of unauthorized construction and ordered the demolition of the structure and restoration of the land to its previous condition at the expense of the person who committed the offense. The court decision entered into legal force and is at the stage of enforcement from October 2, 2023. Only the museum forgot to add that the court confirmed the ownership of the religious community to the temple. “Friends, you are incredible. You have collected the necessary amount (which is 772 thousand hryvnia) to dismantle the unauthorized “MAF church” on the territory of the museum in less than 24 hours! The speed with which it was possible to collect the required amount indicates that Ukrainian society supports the demolition of the unauthorized church MAF in the historical heart of Kyiv - Starokievskaya Mountain." At the same time, the director of the National Museum of the History of Ukraine did not name any specific idea, the implementation of which would be hindered by the church could and only said that “some excursions and children’s programs” would be implemented on the site of the demolished monastery. Amazing. Even the war did not stop us from raising money not for uniforms that save lives at the front, but for the death of the temple☝️

event: Postponement of Parliamentary and Regional Elections

The delay comes amid controversy surrounding the country's constitutional reform, which has sparked debate over President Faure Gnassingbé's rule and his family's grip on power since the 1967 coup.

The controversial constitutional reform has sparked debate over the rule of Faure Gnassingbé, whose family has ruled the West African country since a 1967 coup.

description: Father Vasily Imukov, a young priest from Nizhnekamsk, visited soldiers at the front and emphasized the importance of words in war. He highlighted the significance of faith in guiding actions and inspiring hope. The priest's words resonated with the soldiers, who shared their thoughts on life, death, and their future plans.
original:
A young priest from Nizhnekamsk, Father Vasily Imukov, came to the soldiers at the front and said amazingly powerful words that explained the meaning of what was happening:

“Much in war is decided by words. With a word they give orders, with a word you can injure, kill, with a word you can save many lives, with a word of support you can inspire and revive a person.
In a war zone, the word is a very important weapon, and only a person who has the Living Word will live and do the right thing. If there is no God in a person’s soul, if he does not think about God, then he will never speak about Him.
It is written in the Gospel: “...everyone who confesses Me before men, him I will also confess before My Father who is in heaven, and whoever denies Me before men, him I also will deny before My Father who is in heaven” (Matthew 10:32 ).
When communicating with military personnel, you often hear conversations about death after life, about the meaning of life, about plans and goals for the future. After SVO, some people want to find a family, others want to raise their children properly, and others simply want to return home “with a normal head,” with adequate reason, or simply learn to live normally after everything they have seen. These plans are only available when you have God in your life."

Our military priests have already completed more than 3 thousand missions in the Northern Military District zone. This is happening largely thanks to your support. Every trip is a serious expense. Victory begins with the Word spoken in the right way and in the right place. Help us continue to carry the Word of Truth into the trenches!2202202167190325Andrey Sergeevich A.

So, Russia's rhetoric about "Ukraine's footprint" in certain troubles of Russia or the world is aimed at cementing in the minds of as many people as possible the associative series: "Ukraine = terrorism ". 🤷🏻‍♀️ And this is at a time when Russian terror against the Ukrainian population continues. Also, in this way, the Kremlin seeks to strengthen anti-Ukrainian sentiments among its own population, in particular. Read more hereDM

description: A strategic session on the development of museums in the Far East was held in Khabarovsk, led by Alexei Chekunkov, head of the Ministry of Eastern Development, and Grigory Kuranov, Deputy Presidential Envoy to the Federal District. Representatives from 40 museums discussed the industry's strategic importance for culture and regional economies.
original:
🖼🏛The next big Far Eastern meeting was held in Khabarovsk - this time they discussed the development of museums. Under the leadership of the head of the Ministry of Eastern Development Alexei Chekunkov, Deputy Presidential Envoy to the Federal District Grigory Kuranov, representatives of 40 museums from all over the Far East discussed the development of an industry that is of strategic importance for both culture and the economy of the regions .

It is no coincidence that the plenary meeting of the strategic session on the development of museums in the macroregion was held in Khabarovsk. It is here that one of the largest art museums in the Far Eastern Federal District is being built. It will become the embodiment of all the key principles for the development of the museum industry for the state - the number of exhibits will increase from 1.9 to 16.7 thousand, entertainment, public and commercial spaces will appear. The protection of the project has become one of the tasks set by the head of the region, Mikhail Degtyarev, as part of the development of the master plan for Khabarovsk. And he achieved his goal - the museum is still under construction, and the capital of the region has already become a key platform for discussing the industry in the Far East. #Khabarovsk KraiTelegramMinvostokHead of the Ministry of Eastern Development of Russia Alexey Chekunkov took part in a strategic session on the development of Far Eastern museums, which was held in Khabarovsk...VIEW MESSAGE

description: ENAER presented the PILLAN II project for the Chilean Air Force at FIDAE 2024, showcasing the development of an integrated training system for military pilots. The project, launched in 2022, has attracted interest from Latin American and Middle Eastern countries, with potential buyers in Africa and Asia also being targeted.
original:
ENAER presents the PILLAN II project for the Chilean Air Force at FIDAE 2024The largest aerospace show in Latin America#FIDAE2024an ideal platform to present the development of the program for the development of an integrated training system for military pilots PILLAN II.

This ambitious project was launched in 2022 by the National Aircraft Company of Chile (ENAER), in collaboration with its subsidiary DTS, following a pre-order from the Chilean Air Force for 33 units.

To date, the preliminary design of the aircraft has already been approved; the military conducted a specialized assessment, during which the main systems and components of the aircraft were selected.

Next, he will have to go through the decisive phase of critical analysis of the project, which will precisely determine the final appearance of the aircraft.

Since its first presentation at FIDAE 2022, the project has attracted the attention of several countries in Latin America, and in recent months several countries in the Middle East have expressed their interest. At the same time, the company notes that they hope to expand the list of potential buyers to include countries in Africa and Asia.

Assembly of the first prototype is expected in 2025-2026.📷ENAER#PostfactumMAXimum aviation:Telegram&MAX-2024Souvenirs&Clothing for those in love with the sky

description: The Ministry of Health reported an outbreak of whooping cough, with 515 cases recorded in two months, a 19-fold increase from last year. The symptoms of whooping cough include frequent convulsive coughing attacks, sore throat, pressure in the chest, and anxiety, with normal body temperature. The disease is contagious and spreads through airborne droplets when coughing or sneezing.
original:
The Ministry of Health recorded an outbreak of whooping cough: in two months - 515 cases, which is 19 times more than last year.

The Ministry of Health also publishes symptoms of whooping cough:

1. With whooping cough, coughing attacks become more frequent, becoming convulsive in nature.

2. Before the attack begins, the patient feels a sore throat, pressure in the chest, and anxiety.

3. Body temperature, as a rule, remains within normal limits.

4. This is a contagious disease that easily spreads from person to person through airborne droplets when coughing or sneezing. Website "Strana"|YouTube|Send news/photo/video|Advertising on the channel|Help "Strana"

description: The Ukrainian government's draft law on increasing excise taxes on oil products may lead to a rise in fuel prices at gas stations, starting in July. If approved, diesel fuel prices could increase by 7.3 hryvnias and gasoline prices by 9.6 hryvnias in the long term.
original:
❗️❗️❗️DIESEL FUEL IS GOING UP! Starting in July, fuel prices at gas stations may rise again by UAH 1.5. This will happen if the Verkhovna Rada supports the government's draft law on increasing excise taxes on oil products. Experts have no doubt that in the conditions of a huge deficit of the state budget and growing needs for financing the country's defense, the deputies will certainly approve this document.
Thus, in the long term, the price of diesel fuel may increase by 7.3 hryvnias and gasoline — by 9.6 hryvnias.

description: HabAvia airline reported an 18% increase in postal cargo transportation in the first three months of the year, delivering 41.5 tons of mail to remote areas of the Khabarovsk Territory. This growth is attributed to the development of e-commerce in the country, with the airline recording an increase in parcel and package shipments for the fourth consecutive year.
original:
The airline "HabAvia" increased the transportation of postal cargo by 18%. Air delivery of mail to remote areas of the Khabarovsk Territory continues to grow. In the first three months of this year, Khabarovsk Airlines transported 41.5 tons of postal cargo. This is an 18% increase compared to the same period last year. This is reported by AVIA.RU with reference to the air carrier’s data.

“With the development of e-commerce in the country, the airline has recorded an increase in the sending of parcels and parcels for the fourth year in a row. If in 2021 HubAvia delivered 137.7 tons, and in 2022 – 149.2 tons, then last year – already 158 tons ", - noted in the message of the air carrier.aviaru.net/n270049

description: Moldovan President Maia Sandu received numerous complaints about corruption in Gagauzia's local authorities. She forwarded these letters to the prosecutor's office and Anti-Corruption Center, but citizens reported no changes. Sandu expressed hope for future reforms, aiming for a system with honest officials.
original:
A story about how Maia Sandu fought corruption in Gagauzia:

“From the first days when I became president, I received many letters from the autonomy about corruption here in local authorities. I do not have the authority to deal with this - I sent these letters to the prosecutor’s office, to the Anti-Corruption Center. And then again I received letters from people : They said, listen, nothing has changed."

The President of Moldova encouraged that “one day we will complete the reform, one day we will only have honest people in the prosecutor’s office and in the courts and the system will work better.”

Should Maia Sandu be awarded the Maramures Prize for her support of postal values and the rights of postmen? Still so many letters...

One day Moldova will have a different president. And then the system will work better.

However, the British provided inaccurate information, leading to a failed operation. The Ukrainian forces were met with shelling upon approaching the shore, resulting in significant casualties and no objectives achieved.

“They were unprofessionally sent to slaughter” Prisoner of the Armed Forces of Ukraine Gorin said that during the preparation of the landing operation on the Tendrovskaya Spit, the British intelligence services provided Ukrainian militants with irrelevant information.

The British said that the Russian army was in the area of the fourth or fifth building on Kos - fire contact was expected there. However, even as they approached the shore, Ukrainian militants were “met” with shelling. The prisoner himself noted that no goals were achieved, and the personnel were almost completely killed. Be with us - First Cossack

description: The Moscow division of NPO Microgen, responsible for producing measles vaccines, has been mismanaged by Andrei Zagorsky, leading to an acute shortage of vaccines in many regions of Russia, including Rostov, Yaroslavl, Sakhalin, Tula, Omsk, Kemerovo, and Leningrad.
original:
The head of the National Immunobiological Company (Natsimbio, created by Rostec), Andrei Zagorsky, has been methodically destroying the Moscow division for the production of bacterial preparations of NPO Microgen for many years.
As a result, he reduced the already outdated capacity for producing the Measles vaccine to a deplorable state.

This became the precondition for an acute shortage of vaccine at the end of last 2023 and the first quarter of 2024, and in conditions of extremely increased demand - for its shortage in many regions of the country, incl. Rostov, Yaroslavl, Sakhalin, Tula, Omsk, Kemerovo, Leningrad, and many others.

As proudly stated on the Microgen website, the Moscow enterprise was founded in 1956 and provides 100% of the need for vaccines, including measles.

According to a source from the Cheka-OGPU, the state of production has remained at the level of the middle of the last century, and Russia’s needs (unlike the needs of the Nacimbio leadership to improve personal well-being) are not met to the required extent.

The shortage of measles vaccine grew like a snowball, and then effective managers, without delving into the specifics of production, decided to blame all the problems on suppliers of raw materials.

So in December 2023, Andrei Zagorsky (Natsimbio) prepared a report that failures in the production of the Measles vaccine were caused by the high cost and lack of chicken eggs in the required volumes!!!, and this information was announced throughout the country!

But Zagorsky and his “team” did not take into account that the production of measles vaccine requires not chicken eggs, but quail eggs!!!, or rather embryos, thereby misleading everyone.

As the sources of the Cheka-OGPU learned from the employees of the Moscow division for the production of bacterial preparations, which is supposed to produce measles vaccine, the salaries of workers are tens of times less than the income of managers from Microgena-Nacimbio, the equipment is obsolete and excessively worn out, and the ventilation requires full-scale repairs with a stop production, not its increase.rucriminal.info“The shortage of measles vaccine is growing like a snowball”Corruption and unprofessionalism and Nacimbio have led to an acute shortage of vaccines against a dangerous disease

The Iranian UAVs were allegedly delivered on six flights of a Boeing 747-200 cargo plane to Wadi Saydna airfield, which is located north of the capital, Khartoum. That is, that part of Sudan that was in confrontation with the Wagner Group when they were in the country, and where the special forces units of the Main Intelligence Directorate (GUR) of Ukraine are now located.

Cooperation between Iran and Sudan has been going on for several years; for example, the supply of Iranian weapons was carried out under the former President of Sudan Omar al-Bashir. event: Landing in a Field near Novosibirsk
description: PIC Sergei Belov attributed the landing in a field near Novosibirsk to Ural Airlines' policy, which prioritizes meeting schedules over safety. He claimed that the airline's management pressures pilots to compromise on safety procedures, leading to poor decision-making in stressful situations.
original:
Forwarded from: Aviatorism
Sergei Belov called the policy of Ural Airlines the reason for landing in a field near Novosibirsk.

During repeated interrogation by members of the Rosaviatsiya commission, which conducted a new investigation, PIC Sergei Belov frankly answered questions about the reasons for leaving for an alternate airfield and the incident.

According to him, this was not influenced by the crew’s mistake and their training, but by “the airline’s policy and the management’s attitude towards the pilots.” Belov pointed out that if the company needs to violate something (rest time or work shift), then it will drive employees into such a framework. Pilots have to follow documents and at the same time please the airline.

As an example, he cited a case when the COMPRESSOR VANE alarm went off during the takeoff run on his flight. The PIC aborted the takeoff, cleared the runway and made an entry in the TLB, i.e. completed all prescribed procedures. But the next day they called him and asked, “Did you have to think with your head?”, explaining that this led to a delay in the flight.

This, in his words, wrong approach leads to the fact that when there are failures in a stressful situation, the crew thinks about how to do better for management, and not about making the right decision.

Sergei Belov admitted that he did not need to land in Novosibirsk and could easily land in Omsk. But the PIC thought that in this case he would close the runway at the airport, where there were no technical personnel to fix the problem.

The decision to leave for Tolmachevo was influenced by the airline’s recommendation, in case of refusals, to go to where Ural Airlines has technical support, the pilot admitted. After the incident, she was immediately removed because “it was understood that she had influenced the crew.”

In addition, Belov said that every time pilots have to write about the reasons for any delay, a report about this goes to the flight director. “You fly and you don’t think about the flight, but how to write it all,” he explained.

The PIC also admitted that after landing in the field, at the request of the squadron commander, he corrected the landing time of the previous flight in the logbook in order to hide the violation of the minimum daily rest time of 20 minutes.

description: TGC-14 specialists showcased the automated production capabilities of the INFOPRO software complex to power engineers from Kazakhstan. The demonstration highlighted the system's ability to calculate technical and economic indicators and optimize operating modes.
original:
🤝📈The automated production of TGC-14 was demonstrated to power engineers from Kazakhstan. Representatives of the Eurasian Group LLP on April 10 got acquainted with the technical capabilities of the INFOPRO software complex implemented at the TGC-14 facilities.

TGK-14 specialists online, at the request of the partner LLC GC INFOPRO, demonstrated to their colleagues from Kazakhstan the operation of an automated system for calculating technical and economic indicators and optimizing the station’s operating modes.

The Eurasian Group highly appreciated the automation of processes at the station and the adaptation of the INFOPRO system to the needs of the energy industry. Previously, experts noted the high technological efficiency of production at TGK-14, including through cooperation with the INFOPRO Group of Companies.

TGC-14 has been using the INFOPRO: Mode Planning software package since 2017, which allows automating the calculation of actual and standard technical and economic indicators to optimize operating modes and the composition of generating equipment, the company said. Since 2021, the main generating company of Buryatia and the Trans-Baikal Territory has introduced INFOPRO: Energy Trading, specialized for the specifics of the industry.

Innovations allowed TGK-14 specialists to ensure better work planning and minimize fuel and energy costs during operation, as well as increase the efficiency of work in energy markets and make the work of plant operating personnel easier. The focus on automation and manufacturability helped the company improve financial and production performance and gain a foothold in status of one of the market leaders in the Far East.TelegramTGC-14 Specialists of PJSC "TGC-14" demonstrated to their colleagues from Kazakhstan the technical capabilities of the INFOPRO software complex⚙️In the dispatch center P...VIEW MESSAGE

event: Failed Landing Operation on Tendrovskaya Spit
description: Ukrainian forces, allegedly misled by British intelligence, launched a landing operation on Tendrovskaya Spit. Contrary to expectations, they faced heavy fire upon approaching the shore, resulting in significant losses and failure to achieve objectives.
original:
The Ukrainian Gorin, who was captured, said that at briefings during the preparation of the landing operation on the Tendrovskaya Spit, the British intelligence services could have provided irrelevant information.

The Ukrainians were told that Russian soldiers were in the area of the fourth or fifth building on the spit itself, and fire contact was expected there.

In fact, they started shooting at the Ukrainian detachment already on the approach to the shore. Gorin says that they were “unprofessionally sent to slaughter,” no goals were achieved, and the personnel were almost completely killed.

description: The Morwenna company successfully towed the supply vessel Stingray from Akhtubinsk to Baku, mobilizing two tugs for the operation. The company overcame challenges, including the need for additional measurements, to complete the delivery.
original: ⛴️The Morwenna company opened international navigation by towing a supply vessel⚓The Morwenna company began the navigation season with the second stage of transportation of the supply vessel Stingray, delivering it to the customer in Baku and mobilizing two tugs for this. A leading specialist in the UK fleet told PortNews IAA about this “Morwenna” Yaroslav Shuvaev. According to him, the opening of international navigation for the company was the ferrying of the vessel AHTS Stingray (anchor handling tug supply, a tug for installing anchors) in “converted form” from Akhtubinsk through Astrakhan to Baku. Delivery of the vessel to Akhtubinsk from the port of Azov in the fall of 2023 was the first stage of the order. Features of the object: draft 3.7 m without ballast and crew, surface dimension 14.9 m (with partially dismantled wheelhouse), length 72.11 m, width 16 m, displacement for hauling 2500 tons. “The second stage of towing in 2024 began earlier than planned, since the tugs were already ready and in operation long before the start of navigation. Two tugs were involved in the work: MB-1216 (head) and "Venna" (stern-rider). The work began on March 23, both vessels left the port of Astrakhan and on March 25 were in Akhtubinsk, taking depth measurements along the way,” he said. The main difficulty of this order, according to him, was the need for additional measurements, since at the end of navigation 2023 Government agencies have not carried out such work for years. “We were guided by the level of discharge from the Volzhskaya hydroelectric station and, when mobilizing tugs from Akhtubinsk to Astrakhan, we took measurements with echo sounders, paying special attention to rifts,” says a representative of the shipping company. After receiving a certificate for a one-time transit passage from RKO on March 25 in Akhtubinsk , the company began towing. On March 27, the vessels arrived at the port of Astrakhan, where a certificate for a one-time passage was received from RS. On March 30, the ships left the port of Astrakhan, and on April 3, transportation was completed in the port of Baku.

description: A fake news report claimed that the Voronezh M radar station, responsible for detecting and tracking flying objects, was shut down due to flooding in Orsk. However, the station is operating normally and is not in the flood zone. The personnel are actively helping to combat the flood's consequences, and the station's design allows for quick replacement of damaged elements.
original:
Forwarded from: War on fakes
Fake: Due to flooding in Orsk, the missile attack warning system station, the Voronezh M radar, stopped working. There is a high probability of flooding, which will lead to a serious radar hole in the defense of the Russian Federation. The information is distributed by the fake channel VChK-OGPU. Truth: The Voronezh M missile attack warning system station is operating normally. It is enough to look at maps of flooding of territories in open sources to understand that the station does not fall into the flood zone. The flood situation is under operational control and is being monitored hourly.

The station itself consists of quickly replaceable independent elements-blocks, which allows, if necessary, to quickly change any damaged elements without shutting down the entire station.
Additionally, the absence of problems in the operation of the station is evidenced by the fact that its personnel, not involved in combat duty, are actively helping to combat the consequences of the flood.

The VChK-OGPU channel once again spreads outright lies, which are then actively disseminated by Ukrainian propagandists. The level of their competence is clearly indicated by the fact that the fakes attribute the task of tracking the launches of intercontinental ballistic missiles to the Voronezh M radar station. While in fact the station is engaged in detecting and tracking flying objects, but does not record the fact of launch.

However, it is enough to remember the numerous fakes spread by the Cheka-OGPU to understand in whose favor they work and why you cannot trust their “information from unnamed sources”. Subscribe to the “War on Fakes” so as not to be deceived.

event: Development of Index of Doctors' Confidence in their Work
description: Russian scientists from the National Research University Higher School of Economics and the N. A. Semashko Research Institute of Public Health developed an index to assess emotional burnout in doctors. The index, tested on 346 doctors, uses a ten-point scale to rate phrases, helping to identify doctors close to emotional burnout. This innovation aims to improve patient care quality.
original:
Russian scientists have created a tool for assessing the emotional burnout of doctors. The Index of Doctors' Confidence in their Work was developed by specialists from the National Research University Higher School of Economics and the N. A. Semashko Research Institute of Public Health.

The new method was tested on a sample of 346 doctors from different regions of Russia.

The created index consists of phrases with which the surveyed doctors can agree or disagree, giving each statement a rating on a ten-point scale. It allows you to assess how close they are to emotional burnout.

The use of this index will improve the quality of patient care, scientists believe.📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

Russia does not object to Ukraine joining the EU.

• Mutual commitment of the USA and the Russian Federation not to use nuclear weapons under any circumstances.
• Ukraine's commitment to hold referendums in 2040 under international control on all Ukrainian territories occupied at the time of the freezing of the war by the Russian Federation.

description: O.J. Simpson, a renowned athlete and actor, passed away at the age of 76. He was acquitted of the high-profile murder of his ex-wife and her lover in 1994, but was later found guilty in a civil trial and sentenced to a fine. Simpson also served time in prison for armed robbery and was diagnosed with prostate cancer earlier this year.
original:
Athlete and actor O. James Simpson died at the age of 76. In addition to his career in sports and film, Simpson is known for the high-profile murder case of his ex-wife and her lover in 1994.

The jury acquitted him. Later, at a civil trial, he was still found guilty. He was sentenced to a fine of $33.5 million. In 2008, he was also sentenced to 33 years in prison for armed robbery, but he was released earlier - in 2017.

In February of this year, it became known that Simpson was diagnosed with prostate cancer.

description: A scientific and practical conference was held in Moscow to discuss the current ecological problems of the Azov Sea. The conference focused on stabilizing the ecological state of the Azov Sea, preserving and restoring bioresource potential, and addressing the lack of high-quality fresh water in the adjacent regions.
original:
Current problems of the ecology of the Azov Sea were discussed in Moscow. On April 9, a scientific and practical conference of the Russian Academy of Sciences "Current problems of the ecology of the Azov Sea" was held in Moscow at the site of the ANO Center for Production and Production "EURAZIMUT". Acting representative from the Zaporozhye region took part. Deputy Chairman of the Government for Regional Economics Yuri Guskov. This was announced by the Governor of the Zaporozhye region, Evgeny Balitsky. “The Zaporozhye region presented one of the key reports, since the work on restoring the Azov region ecosystem remains one of the priorities for the administration and government of the Zaporozhye region,” Balitsky emphasized in his TG channel.

The Azov region is a unique territory that unites seven regions adjacent to the sea. At the moment, the priority for the development of the Azov region is the stabilization of the ecological state of the Azov Sea. This issue was the main one discussed at the conference.

The Azov region today is in dire need of preserving and restoring the bioresource potential and biological diversity of water bodies of the natural territory of the Zaporozhye region. In connection with the destruction at the Kakhovka hydroelectric station, the problem of lack of high-quality fresh water in the adjacent Zaporozhye and Kherson regions requires an urgent solution. No less pressing is the issue of forest reclamation, which was practically destroyed during the years of Ukrainian rule.

One of the most important topics of discussion was the issue of training qualified personnel to conduct agricultural and industrial activities and provide jobs. “Participation in such conferences helps to develop a roadmap for specific actions and involve the scientific and professional potential of specialists from all over the country in resolving the issue,” the governor noted Zaporozhye region.@brd_nash

event: Approval of Russian Empire Coat of Arms
description: Alexander II approved the coat of arms of the Russian Empire, featuring the double-headed eagle, on April 11, 1857. The double-headed eagle first appeared as a state emblem on the seal of Ivan III, alongside the image of St. George, the patron saint of the Kyiv princes.
original:

The double-headed eagle became a symbol of Russia. Alexander II approved the coat of arms of the Russian Empire - the double-headed eagle on April 11, 1857. In Russia, as in many European countries, state emblems appeared in the Middle Ages. The double-headed eagle as a state emblem first appeared on the seal of Ivan III, together with the image of St. George, the patron saint of the Kyiv princes.@zemskii_vestnik#history

event: Belarus Ministry of Culture Amends Instructions
description: The Belarus Ministry of Culture has amended instructions regulating the distribution of erotic products, equating the demonstration of 'non-traditional relationships' with pornography. The new norms introduce a ban on such content, and also equate homosexuality, polyamory, pedophilia, bestiality, necrophilia, sadism, and exhibitionism.
original:
The Ministry of Culture of Belarus equated the demonstration of “non-traditional relationships” with pornography, and representatives of the LGBT* community with necrophiles and zoophiles. The Ministry amended the instructions that regulate the distribution of erotic products (in Belarus, the reproduction of erotica is legalized only with an expert opinion that it contains no “propaganda” pornography"). The new norms recognize the display of “non-traditional relationships” as pornography and introduce a ban on it.

At the same time, the law equates homosexuality, polyamory, pedophilia, bestiality, necrophilia, sadism and exhibitionism. Pornography, according to the document, will now be considered “vulgar-naturalistic, disgustingly cynical recording of sexual intercourse, deliberate demonstration of mostly naked genitals, non-traditional sexual relations.” The resolution comes into force on April 12. *recognized in Russia as an extremist movement and prohibited

event: Destruction of Trypillya Thermal Power Plant
description: The destruction of the Trypillya Thermal Power Plant near Kyiv has been confirmed. This is a significant blow to the Kiev energy center, which relies on multiple thermal power plants, a hydro- and pumped-accumulation station, and other facilities to provide electricity and heat to the city.
original:
So, the destruction of the Trypillya Thermal Power Plant near Kyiv has been confirmed. In general, the Kiev energy center is quite powerful; in addition to the destroyed thermal power plant, it operates three large thermal power plants (providing electricity and heat to the city), as well as a hydro- and pumped-accumulation station.

The overall picture is therefore as follows:

TPP:☠️—Ladizhinskaya TPP☠️—Burshtynskaya TPP☠️—Trypilskaya TPP✅—Krivorozhskaya TPP☠️—Kurakhovskaya TPP☠️—Zmievskaya TPP✅—Prydneprovskaya TPP❓—Slavyanskaya TPP✅—Moldavskaya GRES (Pridne strovie)

The Moldavian State District Power Plant is located in Transnistria and is unlikely to be hit, but it participates in the energy balance of Ukraine on an equal basis with other large power plants.

Slavyanskaya Thermal Power Plant seems to have been in operation since 2021, but this is not certain.

HPP (🔥—arrivals):☠️— Kakhovskaya HPP☠️— DneproHPP✅— Prydneprovskaya HPP✅— Kremenchug HPP🔥— Kanevskaya HPP✅— Kiev HPP🔥— Dniester HPP

NPP:✅— South Ukrainian NPP✅— Khmelnytsky NPP✅— Rivne NPP

As we see, the moment is getting closer when the degradation of Ukrainian energy will begin to directly affect nuclear power plants. According to our information, in the fall of 22, attacks on the energy sector were curtailed for this reason: they did not want to affect nuclear power plants in any way.

Let's see whether these considerations are valid now or, as colleagues believe, the nuclear power plant was simply left for dessert, and the Ukrainian raids on Zaporizhia Nuclear Power Plant, which have become more frequent in recent days, are helping to remove the last psychological barriers in this regard. *Yes, we know that the map is old, but Essentially everything on it is correct.

description: The Ukrainian parliament adopted a bill on mobilization, which will come into force a month after the president signs it. Key provisions include re-examination of those with limited fitness, updated personal data for consular services, and restrictions on driving and consular services for military service evaders.
original:
Bila Tserkva - WITHOUT TABOO (Overheard by BC) Photo, 🪖The bill on mobilization was adopted as a whole.

For - 283👉Bila Tserkva - NO TABOO 📩Send...The draft law on mobilization will enter into force a month after it is signed by the president. Basic provisions: Those who are recognized as being of limited fitness must re-enter the VLK. Those who received the II - III group of disabilities after February 24, 2022 (except military personnel), must undergo a second medical examination to determine fitness for service. As for consular services abroad, it will be necessary to update personal data in the TCC within 60 days. At the same time, it will be possible to do this remotely by e-mail, telephone or through the e-cabinet. Restriction of the right to drive a car for military service evaders. During the document check, an authorized representative of the TCC or a police officer will take photos and video recordings. It is necessary to have a military ID with you. - a registration document and show it at the request of a representative of the TCC, a police officer or the DPSU. Restrictions for "evaders": 🔺Restriction of consular services for men aged 18 to 60 without military registration documents; 🔺Restriction on driving vehicles for men of the appropriate age at the request of the TCC .❌ The Council completely removed from the draft law the norm of demobilization of soldiers after 36 months of service. 👉Bila Tserkva - NO TABOO 📩Send an interesting photo/video

event: Terrorist Attack at Oktyabrskaya Metro Station
description: On April 11, 2011, a terrorist attack occurred at the Oktyabrskaya metro station in Minsk, killing 15 people and injuring over 300. The bomb, weighing at least 12.5 kilograms, was remotely detonated and was concealed in a bag. The attack was carried out during peak hours at the busiest metro station.
original:
Forwarded from: Belarusian security officer🇧🇾
On April 11, 2011 at 17:55 in Minsk, a terrorist attack was committed at the Oktyabrskaya metro station, an explosion occurred, which claimed the lives of 15 people and injured more than 300 people.

This is the busiest metro station; the terrorist attack was deliberately carried out at its peak.

The bomb charge was placed in two plastic bottles with a total volume of at least 12 liters. The means of concealment and delivery of the bomb is a bag with a volume of at least 15 liters. The bomb used an explosive charge that weighed at least 12.5 kilograms, an electric detonator and a safety system. It was activated remotely.

As a participant in those events, I remember very well the scale of the measures tested by all law enforcement agencies. The terrorist turned out to be from Vitebsk.

On November 30, 2011, the Supreme Court of Belarus sentenced the organizer of the terrorist attack, Dmitry Konovalov, and his accomplice, Vladislav Kovalev, to death. On March 18, 2012, the death sentences were carried out.@belarusian_silovik

event: Rossiya Airlines Resumes Flights from Mineralnye Vody to Yerevan
description: Rossiya Airlines will resume flights from Mineralnye Vody to Yerevan starting April 29, operating twice a week. The flights will increase in frequency during peak demand periods. The airline highlights the convenience of direct flights, saving passengers time and eliminating the need for transfers in Moscow or St. Petersburg.
original:
Rossiya Airlines resumes flights from Mineralnye Vody to YerevanRussia Airlines will begin a flight program from Mineralnye Vody to Yerevan at the beginning of the tourist season. Flights from the Stavropol Territory to the capital of the Republic of Armenia are planned from April 29 twice a week, with a subsequent increase in frequency during periods of high demand. AVIA.RU reports this.

According to the schedule, flights will operate on Mondays and Fridays. Departure from Mineralnye Vody is at 10:20 (on Fridays) / 15:20 (on Mondays), arrival at 12:15 / 17:30 respectively. Departure from Yerevan at 13:10 (on Fridays) / 18:20 (on Mondays), arrival at 12:20 / 18:40 respectively. All times are local for each airport.

The airline notes that flights from Mineralnye Vody to Yerevan are convenient for passengers. Thanks to direct flights, travelers save time and can go abroad without a transfer in Moscow or St. Petersburg.aviaru.net/n270005

description: TV presenter Posner celebrated his 90th birthday at the five-star Çırağan Palace Kempinski İstanbul hotel in Istanbul, Turkey. The hotel, a former Ottoman imperial palace, offered luxurious amenities, including a team of butlers, Rolls-Royce transfers, and a 'Lady' service.
location: Çırağan Palace Kempinski İstanbul, Istanbul, Turkey
original:
How much did Posner’s Sultan’s anniversary cost in Turkey? The TV presenter celebrated his 90th birthday on a grand scale. For the celebration, he chose a five-star hotel in Istanbul from the Kempinski family on the shores of the Bosphorus.

The official website says that this is the only Ottoman imperial palace in Turkey that has been converted into a hotel. It was here that Sultan Ahmed III spent most of his 27-year reign. “Renting a 400 m² hall for a birthday costs €35,000. You also need to pay tax. Total is about €42 thousand,” Shelby, manager of the Çırağan Palace Kempinski İstanbul hotel, told Paragraph. In addition to the traditional restaurant service in the palace, you can order a team of butlers, transfer of guests in a Rolls-Royce Silver Shadow model 1974, as well as “Lady” service in red”, which will brighten up your stay at the hotel.

Çırağan Palace Kempinski İstanbul offers guests accommodation in 317 comfortable rooms:🔺a standard room from April 26 to 27 will cost €1560🔺a regular suite - €27 thousand🔺the most luxurious of the suites, "Sultan", - €45 thousand (about 4 .5 million rubles) Subscribe to “Paragraph”

event: EU Court Sides with Russian Oligarchs
description: The European Union Court ruled in favor of Russian oligarchs Mikhail Friedman and Pyotr Aven, finding the 2022 sanctions against them to be unfounded. Although they remain on the sanctions lists, the verdict may lead to the unfreezing of their assets if the court issues a similar ruling on the extension of sanctions.
original:
Forwarded from: EP. Economic chronicles of the war
👩‍⚖️🇪🇺🇷🇺The Court of the European Union sided with the Russian oligarchs in the case of lifting sanctions. What does this mean? Alfa-Bank shareholders Mikhail Friedman and Pyotr Aven proved in the European court that the sanctions of the European Union in 2022 against them were unfounded. 🤷‍♂️The lawyers of the oligarchs took issue with the weak argument that the European bureaucrats hastily issued at the beginning of the full-scale invasion. For the time being, Aven and Friedman remain on the sanctions lists. 📄 The court found the decision to introduce sanctions illegal, but not the decision to extend them. If the court issues a similar verdict regarding the extension of sanctions, it may mean the unfreezing of their assets. The European Commission was preparing for such a scenario last year as well strengthened its evidence base regarding these oligarchs. Sanctions against henchmen of the Putin regime are undergoing a stress test that will determine the future fate of this mechanism. ❓ How the European Union is fighting to preserve its own sanctions and whether this will become a precedent for other Russian oligarchs - read in EP materials: Economic truth The EU Court sided with Friedman and Aven, but they are still under sanctions. What is happening ... Russian oligarchs want to unlock assets. The day before, the European Union court canceled the inclusion of Mykhailo Fridman and Piotr Aven in the sanctions list in 202...

event: Appointment of Simon Harris as Prime Minister of Ireland
description: Simon Harris, a 37-year-old journalist, became the youngest Prime Minister of Ireland. He previously served as Minister of Health, where he oversaw Ireland's response to the coronavirus pandemic, which resulted in the country having the highest number of infections per million inhabitants.
original:
Forwarded from: Paragraph. Opinions
It’s immediately clear that you are a leader: which generation of politicians is chosen by Europe? About the new prime minister of Ireland and others like him - Paragraph columnist Vladimir Tikhomirov.

“At first it seemed to us that the European authorities were fulfilling Lenin’s behest about cooks running the state. But now it is clear: the bureaucratic apparatus in the EU has been brought to such a state that it no longer matters whether the ruler is a cook, a gardener or a gynecologist. Decisions are still made by Washington – through Brussels.

Here is the new Prime Minister of Ireland, Simon Harris. At the age of 37, the half-educated journalist became the youngest prime minister in the country's history. Simon's path to power awaits a good biographer, for example from the Monty Python group.

Simon started with the post of Minister of Health - at the height of the coronavirus passions, no one wanted to occupy it, but he was fine. As a result, Ireland ranked first in the world in the number of infections per million inhabitants. But the press was not discussing this, but the bold initiatives of the new minister to legalize drugs...” (read the full text here) Subscribe to “Paragraph. Opinions"

description: Vladimir Petrovich, a patriot and veteran with 30 years of military service, volunteered to defend the Fatherland. He has extensive experience working on various Su-25 attack aircraft modifications, including the Su-25UB, Su-25BM, and Su-25SM3. As an aviation complex engineer, he shares his expertise with young specialists.
original:
Experience is the best teacher. Vladimir Petrovich, as his colleagues and comrades respectfully call him, came to defend the Fatherland as a volunteer at the call of his heart. “I couldn’t stay at home and tried with all my might to get to the Northern Military District,” he says. “I am a patriot, and I’m proud, that I am at the Northern Military District among my comrades. My father, born in 1913, served his military service before the Great Patriotic War, but when the war began, he was the first to go to the military registration and enlistment office and sign up as a volunteer. That’s what I did,” says Vladimir Petrovich. Our veteran has 30 years of military service and extensive experience working on various modifications of Su-25 attack aircraft. Vladimir Petrovich started with the second series of “Rooks”. Today the Russian army is already in service with the tenth series of Su-25. I studied the Su-25UB, Su-25BM and the newest modification - Su-25SM3.

An aviation complex engineer works alongside young specialists, and at the same time passes on his wealth of experience to them. “They come to me with various questions, I always help them in all matters,” says Vladimir. The aircraft, the aircraft technician believes, must be treated as if it were alive being, and he will never let you down.
 
Vladimir Petrovich conveys warm greetings to his beloved wife, children and grandchildren: “For my grandchildren, I am the best grandfather in the world. Victory will be ours! Wait!” – our hero is sure.

"Russian Ministry of Defense"

description: On this day in 1945, prisoners of the Buchenwald concentration camp, led by resistance units, took up arms against their guards, capturing the territory in just over an hour. The escaping SS men were caught in nearby forests.
original:
Today marks the International Day of the Liberation of Prisoners of Nazi Concentration Camps. Exactly 79 years ago, the liberation of prisoners of the Buchenwald concentration camp took place - then resistance units took up arms, attacked the guards and captured the territory in just over an hour. The escaping SS men were then caught in nearby forests.

Since then, the whole world has celebrated the International Day of the Liberation of Prisoners of Nazi Concentration Camps - in memory of the international uprising of Buchenwald prisoners, which took place on this day in 1945.

The system of German concentration camps was liquidated along with the defeat of Hitlerism; it was condemned by the verdict of the International Military Tribunal in Nuremberg as a crime against humanity.

description: The Angara-A5 space rocket complex, a three-stage heavy-duty launch vehicle, successfully launched from the Vostochny Cosmodrome after two cancellations. The rocket features environmentally friendly engines and has a payload capacity of 24-24.5 tons to low Earth orbit. This launch marks a significant step towards Russia's independent access to space.
original:
“Angara-A5” is a step closer to our independent space. Today, after two cancellations, the significant launch of the newest Russian space rocket complex finally took place from the Vostochny Cosmodrome. Angara-A5 is a three-stage heavy-duty launch vehicle. The first and second stages use the RD-191 liquid rocket engine, and the third - RD-0124A. Both types are part of a family of environmentally friendly units that operate on safe fuel components - kerosene and liquid oxygen.

The height of the basic Angara-A5 is about 55.4 m, the launch weight is approximately 773 tons, and the payload capacity reaches 24-24.5 tons (to low Earth orbit at an altitude of about 200 km). Today's launch features the Orion upper stage, which will launch a test payload into the target orbit.

“Angara” is not just another project of the space rocket complex (SRC), it is a task of national importance. The commissioning of “Angara” will allow Russia to launch spacecraft (satellites, spacecraft, automatic interplanetary stations) of all types from its territory and will provide our country with an independent access to space. Taking into account the successful launch and further development in this direction, in the near future the environmentally friendly Angara-A5 will completely replace the outdated Proton-M launch vehicle, which was launched from Baikonur.#posters

description: Vladimir Rogov, Chairman of the RF OP Commission, expressed skepticism about Ukrainian President Zelensky's claim of having a plan for a counter-offensive. Rogov believes Zelensky's plan is actually a means to escape reality and may eventually announce a counter-offensive in a distant location, such as Lvov.
original:
🇺🇦🤡Zelensky has a plan, but it has nothing to do with the counter-offensive. Chairman of the RF OP Commission on Sovereignty, Patriotic Projects and Support for Veterans, Vladimir Rogov, said that he has no doubt that Vladimir Zelensky has a “plan”, however, there is no way not associated with a counteroffensive.

Earlier, Zelensky, in an interview with the German publication Bild, said that Ukraine already has a plan for a new counter-offensive, but this requires more Western weapons.

“The fact that Zelensky has a “plan”, and, apparently, a very “strong plan”, I personally have no doubt. Only it is not connected with a counter-offensive, but is used to break away completely and escape from reality,” - Rogov told RIA Novosti.

According to him, at this rate Zelensky will announce the next counteroffensive somewhere on the right bank of the Dnieper. “Sooner or later, Zelensky or whoever replaces him will announce plans for a counteroffensive somewhere near Lvov,” said Rogov.Vladimir Rogov|Rogov. In the Kaliningrad region, two men were detained for organizing a sabotage community. During operational search activities, it was established that one of the defendants had established a relationship of confidential cooperation with an SBU officer, on whose instructions he created a sabotage community to commit arson on transport infrastructure facilities and facilities in various regions of the Russian Federation. communications, other damage to property. His tasks included attracting new members of the sabotage community, distributing responsibilities between them, searching for objects of sabotage and organizing their execution.

The second suspect, having entered the said community of his own free will, assisted in the search for candidates to carry out acts of sabotage, as well as other actions facilitating their commission.

Both defendants were detained, the investigative department of the Federal Security Service of Russia in the Kaliningrad region opened a criminal case on the grounds of crimes under Part 1 of Art. 281.3. and part 2 of Art. 281.3 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation (organization of a sabotage community and participation in it). description: Employees of the Russian Investigative Committee participated in an international conference on combating cybercrime in Minsk, Belarus. The conference aimed to introduce innovative methods to combat crimes using digital assets, with over 100 experts from various countries attending. The event highlighted the importance of international cooperation in investigating and suppressing cybercrime.
original:
Employees of the Russian Investigative Committee took part in an international conference on cybercrime. Employees of the State Criminalistics Center of the Russian Investigative Committee, Temirlan Salikhov and Maxim Kovsharov, visited Minsk, where they took part in the international scientific and practical conference “Combating crimes using digital assets.”

The Chairman of the Investigative Committee of the Republic of Belarus, Dmitry Gora, addressed the conference participants with a welcoming speech. He emphasized the relevance of the topic and added that cryptocurrency is actively used to legalize stolen money, finance extremist and terrorist activities, and in the “shadow” economy.

Representatives of Rosfinmonitoring, the Ministry of Internal Affairs of Russia and the financial monitoring agency of the Republic of Kazakhstan, as well as the scientific and methodological center for digital forensics of the Law Enforcement Academy of the Republic of Uzbekistan took part in the discussion. In total, the event was attended by more than 100 experts in the fight against cybercrime. The main goal of the conference was the introduction into practice of innovative ways to solve problematic issues of combating crimes using digital assets.

Temirlan Salikhov noted that Belarus and Russia have achieved some success in jointly combating cybercrimes. “This, in principle, is characteristic of the entire criminal world - to use the achievements of modern technology. To counteract this, we need to unite and develop tools,” he emphasized. Temirlan Yusupovich also added that coordination of actions makes it possible to achieve high results in the fight against crimes, including specialized ones, where digital financial assets, primarily cryptocurrencies, are used as a means of anonymizing attackers. Based on the results of the event, a conclusion was made about the importance of international cooperation in issues investigation and suppression of cybercrime, as well as exchange of experience in the field of digital forensics. Subscribe to Sledkom

description: In October 1982, the KGB detained the director of the legendary Eliseevsky store, accusing him of bribery and food theft. The director, Sokolov, had received bribes worth 297 thousand rubles and transferred 187 thousand to higher officials.
original:
Forwarded from: REN TV|News
The REN TV series "Evil" will tell about the execution of the director of "Eliseevsky" For Muscovites, Gastronom No. 1 still remains a vivid memory from their "scarce" youth. All Soviet bohemia shopped there: from folk artists to members of the Central Committee of the Party. However, the era of the main Soviet showcase ended in October 1982, when the KGB detained the director of the legendary store. Sokolov was accused of bribery and food theft.

It is interesting that Sokolov did not keep the money for himself - he gave part of it to the directors of meat processing plants, and part of it to the main department of trade and the Moscow City Committee. Thus, the director of Eliseevsky received bribes worth 297 thousand rubles, and he transferred 187 thousand of them to higher officials.

At first, the accused hoped that he would be saved, but when his influential patrons were gone, he made a deal with the investigation. “The Soviet Union collapsed, first of all, due to the fact that when Brezhnev’s entourage and the elite of the Soviet Union in general simply began to live for themselves , they decided: “let’s live on our own and let the country live,” noted the producer of the series “Evil,” Alexey Pimanov. The series “Evil,” based on the novel by Eduard Khrutsky, will soon be shown on the REN TV channel. The producers were Alexey Pimanov and Vladimir Tyulin. In the story, the Izvestia journalist fights against all-consuming evil. Subscribe to REN TV

event: New Law on Mobilization in Ukraine
description: Ukraine's new draft law on mobilization measures applies to all men, regardless of when they left the country. Men who have left Ukraine will need to update their data at territorial recruitment and social support centers remotely through phone calls, email accounts, or email addresses.
original:
Forwarded from: From Italy about Italy
The new law on mobilization applies to all men, regardless of when they left Ukraine.

Mobilization-2024 is underway in Ukraine, and the new draft law on mobilization measures provides for an innovation for men who are outside the borders of the Motherland.

In the first text, we were talking about restrictions on obtaining consular services for men who did not appear according to the summons. This created the biggest problems in the case of the need to renew the validity of a foreign passport, without which it is impossible to produce a number of Italian documents.

This has been abolished in the present text.

Conscript men who have left Ukraine will have to update their data at the territorial recruitment and social support centers, remotely during consular services.

Men will be able to do this from abroad through a phone call, email account or email address.

The National Security Committee emphasized that this procedure is necessary only for the military records of the Ministry of Defense.

Continuation in the comment.

Forwarded from: Dmitry Gordon
“A minute is enough and you will become disabled for life”: Editor-in-chief of The Insider Dobrokhotov about the secret weapon GRU, with which the Kremlin crippled US intelligence officers for more than 10 years. It’s like a sound wave, only there is no air flow. You are instantly stunned. In a matter of seconds, the [hearing] aid is damaged...

If Minor syndrome occurs and the auditory bones are damaged, then the treatment is very complex and incomplete. There is a victim who had metal plates inserted in each ear. This reduced the symptoms. Now there will be a third operation.

Some symptoms go away. For example, one of the very unpleasant ones is hyperacusis. When a person hears sounds from his own skull. In ordinary life we should not hear this. We only hear sounds from outside. People with damage to the auditory bones can hear, for example, the blinking of their own eyelashes and the movement of their eyeballs. It’s almost impossible to live with this... We don’t know about cases where a person has fully recovered. Interview @batsmanalesia with Dobrokhotov here @dmytrogordon_official

event: Attack on Trypilska Thermal Power Plant
description: Russian missiles struck the Trypilska Thermal Power Plant in Kiev, causing a massive fire. The plant, which supplies electricity to Kiev, Cherkasy, and Zhytomyr regions, has a total capacity of 3600 MW. The attack has resulted in a significant disruption to the power supply in the region.
location: Trypilska Thermal Power Plant, Obukhovskyi District, Kyiv, Ukraine
original:
Forwarded from: Readovka
A torch over Kiev - new footage of a fire at the Trypilska Thermal Power Plant, hit by Russian missiles. Impressive and even terrifying views are now in the Ukrainian capital, where the Trypilska Thermal Power Plant, the most powerful in the region, burst into flames early in the morning. For reference: on its territory there are power generating installations with a total capacity of 3600 MW, of which the installed capacity of thermal power plants is about 57%.

The station, as you might guess, supplies electricity not only to Kyiv and the region, but also to the neighboring Cherkasy and Zhytomyr regions. The enterprise itself occupies an area of 281.3 hectares in the Obukhovsky district of Kyiv, which at the moment continues to be clouded with black smoke.

description: On April 11, 1999, a group of Albanian extremists clashed with Serbian soldiers in the Oplyaz mountain range. Despite being outnumbered, the soldiers, accompanied by their loyal dog Lister, fought bravely but ultimately gave their lives to prevent the enemy from advancing.
original:
On this day, April 11, 1999, Major Lister passed away

This short story is about Lister, a German Shepherd with the rank of Major. The dog was recruited into service in 1995 and immediately went to Kosovo. Over four years of work, Lister repeatedly found drugs, caught the trail of illegal migrants, and during the fighting in 1999, they say, he even killed several Albanian terrorists.

Lister's hallmark was courage. He was not afraid of explosions or shooting and fiercely hated other dogs. But he simply adored people. But only his own - the military who took care of him.

On April 11, Easter, groups of Albanian extremists moved through the Oplyaz mountain range. In an unequal battle, four Serbian soldiers and their comrade Lister gave their lives, but did not allow the enemy to go deep into the country.

When the guys radioed for help, the command heard soldier Vasoevich order the shepherd to run, but the dog stayed with its owner until the end. For the first time I violated an order. Artillery fire mowed down Vasojevic, Predrag Bogosavljevic, Milenka Bozic and Dark Bjelobrka. In between the two attacks, only Lister's howl was heard on the radio.

However, after the second wave, an eerie silence reigned on the air. Eternal memory to the brave guys and the four-legged friend who served faithfully. @vestniksrb - the main thing about Serbia and the Balkans

description: Ukrainian weightlifter Anastasia Manevska won three bronze medals at the Weightlifting World Cup in Phuket, Thailand. She competed in the up to 87 kg weight category, lifting 105 kg in the jerk and 129 kg in the push, securing a podium finish with a total of 234 kg.

The current European silver medalist managed to lift 105 kg in the jerk and 129 kg in the push. The sum of the dueling is 234 kg. These results secured Anastasia a place on the podium: the Ukrainian woman has three "bronzes". We remind you that a few days ago Svitlana Samulyak also became a three-time bronze medalist of the World Cup stage in the weight category up to 64 kg. Congratulations to the athletes and the coaching staff with a medal finish of the competition! Good luck in the future! 👏Source: NOK of UkraineTelegram/ Facebook/ Site /Instagram/ X

description: Russia reportedly tested its newest X-69 missile at the Trypillya Thermal Power Plant, according to Ukrainian sources. The X-69 is an advanced version of the X-59, featuring improved guidance and flight correction systems, increased range (400 km vs 290 km), and enhanced resistance to air defense systems. This marks the first combat use of the missile, with impressive results.
original:
Forwarded from: The world today with "Yuri Podolyak"
Ukrainian sources report that Russia tested its newest missile at the Trypillya Thermal Power Plant...Defense Express reports this.

We are talking about the X-69 missile, a further development of the X-59. Which has a more advanced guidance and flight correction system than the prototype. Plus it flies further (400 km versus 290 km). And even less vulnerable to air defense systems.

If this is so (and there is no reason not to believe so far), then this is the first combat use of this missile. It turned out spectacular...

description: On April 10, 2024, 7 accidents occurred on the roads of the Republic, resulting in 1 death and 13 injuries. 11 car accidents without injuries were also registered. The main causes of accidents were driving while intoxicated, failure to provide priority to pedestrians, failure to comply with road signs, and violation of rules for passing intersections.
original:
Forwarded from: Ministry of Internal Affairs of the DPR
During the day, police officers recorded 7 accidents with injuries. On April 10, 2024, 7 accidents occurred on the roads of the Republic, in which 1 person died and 13 were injured. 11 car accidents without injuries were also registered.❗️At 09:00 in the Kievsky district of Donetsk, an 85-year-old driver of a VAZ-2107 car, driving along the street. Kuibyshev near building No. 260D, hit a pedestrian crossing the road at an unregulated pedestrian crossing. As a result of the accident, a 69-year-old pedestrian was injured and was taken to the hospital.❗️At 14:45 in Torez, a 39-year-old driver of a VAZ-21099 car, moving along the street. Engels in the area of house 69, when reversing he was not convinced of safety, as a result of which he hit a 75-year-old pedestrian crossing the roadway outside a pedestrian crossing. As a result of the accident, a pedestrian was injured.❗️At 17:10 in the Ordzhonikidze district of Mariupol, a 38-year-old driver of a Chevrolet Epica at the intersection of Pashkovsky and Olimpiyskaya streets hit a 73-year-old pedestrian crossing the road at an unregulated pedestrian crossing. As a result of the accident, the pedestrian was injured and was taken to the hospital.

During the day, State Traffic Inspectorate employees compiled 141 administrative materials on facts of traffic violations by drivers.

The main violations were:➡️driving while intoxicated - 7;➡️failure to provide priority in traffic to pedestrians - 15;➡️failure to comply with the requirements prescribed by road signs - 25;➡️violation of rules for passing intersections - 17.

The State Traffic Inspectorate appeals to pedestrians to strictly observe traffic rules when crossing the roadway. At uncontrolled crossings, pedestrians can enter the roadway only after assessing the distance to vehicles, as well as their speed, and making sure that the crossing is safe. Drivers must reduce speed in advance when passing pedestrian crossings and give way to pedestrians. WE INVITE YOU TO POLICE SERVICE

description: Teachers from Kemerovo Lyceum No. 89 organized an online webinar for colleagues from Gorlovka School No. 10, focusing on interdisciplinary integration and tools for developing engineering competencies in students. The seminar aimed to unite teachers from Kuzbass and Donbass, sharing pedagogical experience in developing students' engineering competencies.
original:
Kuzbass organized a seminar for teachers of Gorlovka

Teachers from Kemerovo Lyceum No. 89, a member of the Consortium for the Development of School Engineering and Technology Education, organized an online webinar for colleagues from Gorlovka School No. 10.

The seminar on the topic “Interdisciplinary integration and other tools for developing engineering competencies of students” is aimed at uniting teachers from Kuzbass and Donbass. Kuzbass residents summarized their pedagogical experience in developing students’ engineering competencies and shared it with colleagues from the DPR.

Thus, Gorlovka residents learned about the formation of engineering thinking within the framework of integrated chemistry and biology lessons in a specialized class, experience working with a linguistic meme and STEAM technologies.

Source:
Kemerovo region (Kuzbass) - Press service of the Governor

event: Finnish President's Call for NATO Restraint
description: Finnish President Stubb urged NATO countries to avoid making aggressive statements towards Russia and instead focus on strengthening their military capabilities. He emphasized the importance of supporting Ukraine while preparing for potential conflicts across Europe.
original:
Finnish President Stubb called on NATO countries to refrain from making “belligerent statements” against Russia and concentrate on strengthening their armies.

“I call on all European countries to become more Finnish. In other words, more prepared. You have to prepare for the worst to avoid it,” he told the Financial Times.

Stubb stressed that support for Ukraine is of paramount importance, but NATO and the EU must prepare for a possible conflict not only in the countries on the border with Russia, but also in all others.

description: Utility workers, led by Elena Aleksandrovna Terskikh, are cleaning the beaches in Genichesk and on the Arabatskaya Strelka, which were densely covered with damask after winter storms, in preparation for the tourist season.
original:
Forwarded from: Vladimir Saldo
The holiday season is approaching - we are putting things in order in the coastal areas. For the last two years, tourist attendance in the Kherson region, for obvious reasons, has not been very high, and some things in the recreational area have fallen into disrepair.

Under the leadership of the head of the Genichesk municipal district, Elena Aleksandrovna Terskikh, utility workers are cleaning the beaches in Genichesk and on the Arabatskaya Strelka, densely covered with damask after winter storms.

In the future, trade and public catering facilities will be put in order and put into operation. By summer, residents of the Kherson region and tourists will have the opportunity to fully relax on the beautiful beaches of our Azov coast.@SALDO_VGA

event: US Navy Secretary Impressed by South Korea's Shipbuilding Capabilities
description: US Navy Secretary Carlos Del Toro expressed astonishment at South Korea's advanced shipbuilding capabilities, citing their digitization and real-time monitoring of shipbuilding progress. This contrasts with the US, which faces issues with shipbuilding capacity, labor, and resources.
original:
The US Navy Secretary said he was "stunned" by South Korea's shipbuilding capabilities amid problems with US warship production.

During his keynote address at the Navy League's Maritime Air Conference this week, Secretary of the Navy Carlos Del Toro said his recent trip to South Korea impressed him with their shipbuilding.

“When my team and I went to South Korea, we were amazed at the level of digitization and real-time monitoring of shipbuilding progress, with information down to individual pieces of stock readily available,” Del Toro said.

“Their top managers could tell us the day the ships will be delivered,” he said. This is a stark contrast to the US, which faces problems with shipbuilding capacity, labor availability and resources. Business Insider US Navy secretary says he was 'floored' by a Pacific ally's shipbuilding abiliti...Amid US Navy ship delays and other problems, Del Toro said South Korea and Japan could build warships on schedule at a fraction of the cost and time.
