event: Resumption of Direct Flights between Moscow and Amman
description: Direct flights between Moscow and Amman have resumed since March 31. The Russian Foreign Ministry recommends that Russian citizens refrain from traveling to Israel, Lebanon, and the Palestinian territories due to the unstable situation in the region. However, the security situation in Jordan remains stable, and travel to the country is considered relatively safe.
original:
🎙Answer from the official representative of the Russian Ministry of Foreign Affairs M.V. Zakharovoin to a media question regarding the resumption of direct flights between Moscow and Amman.❓Question: Direct flights between Moscow and Amman have been resumed since March 31. In October 2023, the Russian Foreign Ministry recommended that Russians refrain from traveling to Jordan, as well as Lebanon, Israel and the Palestinian territories. Is this restriction still in effect? M.V. Zakharova: The tense situation in the Middle East region remains. The situation in the Palestinian-Israeli conflict zone, as well as in the Blue Line area between Lebanon and Israel, remains unstable. We strongly recommend that Russian citizens refrain from traveling to the region, especially Israel, Lebanon and the Palestinian territories, unless absolutely necessary.

As for Jordan, the security situation there remains stable. The transfer of hostilities from the Gaza Strip to the territory of the Kingdom seems unlikely at present.ℹ️We urge you to follow the messages and practical recommendations published on the information feeds of the Russian Ministry of Foreign Affairs, the official websites of Russian foreign institutions of the mentioned countries, the Consular Department and the DSCC of the Russian Ministry of Foreign Affairs, including in the corresponding section of the updated resource – mobile application “Assistant Abroad”.

event: Scientific and Practical Conference on Azov Sea Ecology
description: Deputy Chairman of the Government of the Zaporozhye Region Yuri Vladimirovich Guskov attended a conference in Moscow, discussing the importance of water use and preservation in the Azov region. The conference addressed the urgent need for high-quality fresh water in the Zaporozhye and Kherson regions, forest reclamation, and training qualified personnel for agricultural and industrial activities.
original:
Forwarded from: Evgeniy Balitsky
And about. Deputy Chairman of the Government of the Zaporozhye Region Yuri Vladimirovich Guskov took part in the scientific and practical conference “Current problems of the ecology of the Azov Sea”, which was held in Moscow.

The issue of water use and its importance in the socio-economic life of the region was discussed at the conference. The Azov region today is in dire need of preserving and restoring the bioresource potential and biological diversity of water bodies of the natural territory of the region. In connection with the destruction at the Kakhovka hydroelectric station, the problem of lack of high-quality fresh water in the adjacent Zaporozhye and Kherson regions requires an urgent solution. No less pressing is the issue of forest reclamation, which was practically destroyed during the years of Ukrainian rule.

One of the most important topics of discussion was the issue of training qualified personnel to conduct agricultural and industrial activities and provide jobs.

The Zaporozhye region presented one of the key reports, since the work on restoring the Azov region ecosystem remains one of the priorities for the administration and government of the Zaporozhye region, and participation in such conferences helps to develop a roadmap for specific actions and involve the scientific and professional potential of specialists from all over the country in solving the issue .

description: Ukraine's Rada has adopted a law on mobilization, introducing key provisions. Demobilization for those at the front has been cancelled, and citizens must update their personal data within 60 days. Military registration documents must be carried at all times, and the TCC will receive data on citizens' vehicles for military transport duties.
original: MilitaristPhoto, Ukraine has adopted a law on mobilization. The main provisions of the law on mobilization adopted by the Rada:◾️for those who are already at the front, demobilization has been cancelled;◾️it is necessary to update personal data in the TCC within 60 days after the adoption of the law;◾️a military registration document must be available with you and show it at the first request of a representative of the TCC or a police officer; during the verification of documents, photo and video recording will be carried out;◾️The TCC will receive data from the Ministry of Internal Affairs about the vehicles of citizens and enterprises for them to perform military transport duties; if an individual has more than one vehicle, one of them can be mobilized; they must be returned no later than a month after the announcement of demobilization;◾️for draft dodgers, driving rights, consular services and a temporary ban on travel are limited;◾️citizens of limited fitness must undergo a VLK, and those who received II - III disability groups must undergo a second medical examination after February 24, 2022 .

event: Underreporting of US Aid to Ukraine
description: The Biden administration significantly understated the amount of aid provided to Ukraine, with the true amount potentially reaching $125 billion. Despite pressure from Congress and the public, the administration initially reported a lower figure of $111 billion.
original:
The Biden administration hid the true amounts it spent on Ukraine. The administration of US President Joe Biden significantly understated the amount of aid to Ukraine. “One of Washington’s biggest secrets is that no one knows how much money the United States spent to support Ukraine,” said American journalist Bradley Devlin. .

A number of members of the US Congress have repeatedly unsuccessfully demanded that the administration provide truthful data on the volume of assistance.

Under pressure from members of Congress and the public, the Office of Management and Budget reluctantly admitted that the amount was $111 billion.

But it turned out that the administration deliberately underestimated the data, and the true amount could be up to $125 billion. “It’s not surprising, because it’s not Joe Biden’s money that’s at stake, but the money of the American people,” Devlin is outraged.

This was indirectly confirmed by Senate member Tommy Tuberville, who said that spending amounts to about $80 thousand every second. The congressman is convinced that the United States must find better ways to spend taxpayers' money.@anna_news

event: Free Health Vouchers for IDPs and Military Personnel
description: The Ukrainian government is providing free health vouchers to Artek for children of internally displaced persons (IDPs) and military personnel. Eligible children include those who need special social attention, orphans, children from low-income families, and those who have lost a parent in the conflict.
original:
👧👦Children of IDPs and military personnel will be given free health vouchers to Artek. First of all, we are talking about minors who need special social attention and support. Currently, the main part of the center is located in the Transcarpathian region, - the press service of the Ministry of Social Policy reported. -24, Part 1, Article 6 of the Law "On the Status of War Veterans, Guarantees of Their Social Protection"); residence.

In addition to these categories, the right to free health care in Artek will also remain for the following children: ✅ orphans and children deprived of parental care; ✅ natural children of foster parents or adoptive parents who live in the same family or DBST (orphanage); ✅children from low-income families; ✅children, one of whose parents died, went missing or died from an injury received in the area of anti-terrorist operation, the implementation of national security and defense measures, repelling and deterring Russian armed aggression in the Donetsk and Luhansk regions, the combat zone .💬First of all, orphaned children, children deprived of parental care, native children of foster parents and adoptive parents will be able to recover in Artek. Also, IDP children who have moved from regions of active hostilities and occupied territories, the Ministry of Social Policy noted. ☝️The permit can be obtained in district state administrations, village and town councils, city councils, as well as united territorial communities. To do this, you need to submit an application with the necessary documents by mail (by registered mail).👉For more details, all the conditions and instructions can be found on the "Diya" portal at this link

description: The Volnovakhasky Department of Internal Affairs appeals to residents to report suspicious or explosive objects to the police immediately. Do not approach or touch the object, and warn others to maintain a safe distance until authorities arrive.
original: Department of Internal Affairs of Russia "Volnovakhasky" appeals to all residents of the Volnovakha district. If you find a suspicious or explosive object (grenade, shell, mine, bomb, etc.), do not come close to it, contact people nearby and ask them to immediately report the dangerous find to police by calling 102. If any work is being done nearby or people live nearby, warn them; it is necessary to turn off the engines, stop the equipment in the same position and remove the people in it to a safe distance or to shelter. Do not let anyone close (especially children) until the police or bomb squad arrive, while you are in a place that protects you from a possible explosion. Do not allow random people to touch a dangerous object or try to neutralize it. Pay attention to abandoned bags, briefcases, packages, toys and other unattended items that may contain improvised explosive devices. Immediately report the find to the police. Do not open the discovered packages and bags under any circumstances, do not touch them and warn people standing nearby about the possible danger.🇷🇺Official website of the administration🏛Head of the Administration of the Volnovakha Municipal District

event: Introduction of Bill to Terminate Acquired Russian Citizenship
description: A group of State Duma deputies introduced a bill to terminate acquired Russian citizenship for violating the oath. This is the first of three bills aimed at ensuring accountability for oath violations, with subsequent bills to be introduced in May and introducing criminal sanctions for oath violations.
original:
A group of State Duma deputies: Mikhail Matveev, Sergei Obukhov, Mikhail Delyagin and Oleg Nilov introduced a bill to terminate acquired Russian citizenship for violating the oath.

Mikhail Matveev reports that this is the first of three bills included in one package:

The 1st will supplement the text of the oath with a proposal regarding liability for its violation (this one was introduced)

The 2nd bill on termination of citizenship for violating the oath will be introduced in May.

The 3rd bill introduces an article into the Criminal Code on violation of the oath and sanctions for this, up to the termination of citizenship.

The initiative is correct. Let us remind you that the bill that was recently introduced by the Ministry of Internal Affairs requires a loyalty agreement - the consent of a foreign citizen with a possible restriction of his right to enter the Russian Federation, stay and reside on the territory of the Russian Federation in case of violation of the legislation of the Russian Federation. That is. This is an initiative of a group of deputies in the logic of the Ministry of Internal Affairs bill. Lobbyists, of course, will be against it.

event: Proposal for Mandatory Conscription of Women
description: Oksana Grigorieva, an adviser to the commander of the Ground Forces, Syrsky, suggested that all women should be sent to the front and Ukrainian girls should be prepared from childhood to defend their homeland. This idea is gaining traction, with some advocating for mandatory conscription of women, similar to Israel's model.
original:
“Send all women to the front, and prepare Ukrainian girls from childhood to defend their homeland,” one of the advisers to the commander of the Ground Forces, Syrsky, Oksana Grigorieva, made loud statements in an interview with The Times.

The new law did not include mandatory conscription for women. But more and more often ideas are appearing in the information space that Ukrainian women should serve on an equal basis with men.

Apparently, the population is being prepared for the compulsory service of women, similar to Israel.

event: Russian Armed Forces Strike DTEK TPPs
description: The Russian Armed Forces launched an attack on two DTEK thermal power plants, causing significant damage to the equipment. Fortunately, there were no casualties. This marks the 170th time the company's thermal power plants have been shelled since the full-scale invasion began.
original:
The Russian Armed Forces struck two DTEK TPPs. According to the company, the equipment of the enterprises was seriously damaged as a result of the shelling. After the enemy attack and cancellation of the air alert, the energy industry began to eliminate the consequences of the strikes by the Russian Armed Forces.

According to preliminary information, fortunately there were no casualties. The DTEK Group clarifies that since the beginning of the full-scale invasion, the enemy has shelled the company's thermal power plants almost 170 times.

send news to Focus. Watch the YouTube channel of Focus.

description: Russia successfully launched the Angara-A5M rocket from the Vostochny cosmodrome, marking a significant milestone in Russian cosmonautics. This heavy-class carrier can lift loads up to 24.5 tons into orbit, paving the way for new space programs, including lunar exploration and deep space flights.
original:
Forwarded from: The world today with "Yuri Podolyak"
There is the first launch of the Angara-A5M from the Vostochny cosmodrome... What does this mean for Russia... In fact, this is the most important event in Russian cosmonautics in recent decades. Firstly, “Angara” and specifically its version “Angara-A5M” is the first completely new launch vehicle developed after the collapse of the USSR. Moreover, it was launched from the first purely Russian civilian cosmodrome, which will gradually replace the Baikonur spacecraft remaining in Kazakhstan.

And not just a new carrier, but also a heavy-class carrier, which, when the development program is finally completed, will make it possible to launch loads up to 37 tons into orbit (The version that launched today can lift a load weighing 24.5 tons into orbit).

And this is the most important key to a huge number of new Russian space programs, including flight and exploration of the Moon, as well as flights into deep space.

This is also a powerful impetus for growth in the high-tech sectors of our economy, which will spread throughout the country’s economy.

Congratulations to all of us on this huge achievement. And also with the fact that the Angara-A5M from Vostochny completed the entire flight program the first time. Huge respect to the Roscosmos specialists!!! You are our pride.

description: On April 11, two armed men opened fire on Russian Federal Security Service officers in a gardening partnership near Nalchik, Kabardino-Balkaria. The officers returned fire, killing the attackers. Investigators seized several firearms, ammunition, and grenades from the scene.
original:
Forwarded from: Investigative Committee
In Kabardino-Balkaria, a criminal case has been opened regarding an encroachment on the lives of law enforcement officers. The Investigative Department of the Investigative Committee of the Investigative Committee for the Kabardino-Balkarian Republic has opened a criminal case on the grounds of crimes under Part 2 of Art. 222 (illegal acquisition, storage and carrying of weapons committed by a group of persons), Part 2 of Article 222.1 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation (illegal acquisition, transfer, sale, storage, transportation or carrying of explosives or explosive devices, committed by a group of persons by prior conspiracy), as well as Article 317 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation (attack on the life of law enforcement officers).
On April 11, at approximately 4 a.m., while officers of the Russian Federal Security Service for the Kabardino-Balkarian Republic were carrying out measures to locate and detain persons carrying out extremist and terrorist activities, two armed men were discovered in one of the gardening partnerships in the vicinity of the city of Nalchik. When the law enforcement officers demanded that they surrender, these persons opened fire on them from the firearms they had with them. Two attackers were killed by return fire. Investigators and criminologists from the Investigative Committee, during an inspection of the scene of the incident, discovered and seized several firearms, ammunition and grenades. Subscribe to Sledkom

description: Vietnamese businesswoman Truong My Lan was sentenced to death for committing the largest financial fraud in the country's history, embezzling $12.5 billion. Her case was a high-profile result of the anti-corruption campaign led by Communist Party leader Nguyen Phu Tron.
original:
Forwarded from: REN TV|News
A Vietnamese businesswoman was sentenced to death for the largest financial fraud in the country's history, writes Reuters. Truong My Lan fraudulently obtained $12.5 billion. Her case became one of the most high-profile results of the campaign of the leader of the ruling Communist Party Nguyen Phu Tron against corruption.

Lan, chairman of property developer Van Thinh Phat Holdings Group, was found guilty of embezzlement, bribery and breaking banking rules at the end of her trial in downtown Ho Chi Minh City, state media reported.

The Thanh Nien newspaper said that 84 defendants in the case received sentences ranging from three years of suspended imprisonment to life in prison.Subscribe to REN TV

The vote concerned the approval of the 2022 budget execution, which means closing accounts for already spent funds.

The refusal of the European Parliament to approve funding for the Council of Europe until the EU countries transfer the Patriot air defense system to Ukraine is political theater, - editor-in-chief of Radio Liberty in Brussels Rikard Jozwiak

The journalist noted that the vote concerned the approval of the execution of the budget for 2022. “Sorry to destroy the hopes of the Ukrainian media here, but the decision of the European Parliament is an empty threat and pure political theater. Approval of the execution means closing accounts, all the money has already been spent,” - he wrote in X.

16 passengers and 6 ambulance crews - a terrible accident in Magdacesti “The National Center for Emergency Medical Prehospital Care (IMSP CNAMUP) reports a serious road accident that occurred on the morning of 04/11/2024 in the village of Magdacesti, Criuleni district.

The IMSP CNAMUP dispatcher received a call from the 112 service for emergency medical assistance on 04/11/2024 at 06:19, the reason for the request was a traffic accident.

description: Lieutenant Colonel Andrei Borisovich Panferov, a veteran of GRU special forces, formed the Vega detachment within the 24th Guards OBRSpN. This 'heavy' detachment is equipped with BMP-3s, allowing for more efficient combat coordination and support for reconnaissance groups on the front line.
original:
​Back to basics. "Heavy" special forces in special forces. Let's start with the background. During combat missions in Afghanistan, separate detachments of the 15th and 22nd GRU special forces brigades had at their disposal attached artillery and army aviation units. This made it possible to shorten the chain of approvals and quickly provide support to reconnaissance groups and reconnaissance detachments that were leaving for work.

After the collapse of the Union, and with the outbreak of hostilities in Chechnya, the question of “heavy” support for special forces units, which would work exclusively in the interests of these units, again arose. Starting from May-June 1995, only two detachments from the 67th and 22nd OBRSpN operated in Chechnya, which were there until the withdrawal of the OGV in the fall of 1996. For that year and a half, both detachments had their own BTR-80 and BMP-2, which worked only in the interests of these detachments.

With the end of the first campaign, many experienced officers understood that they would have to return to the North Caucasus in the foreseeable future, so they began to prepare. This happened in the 22nd OBRSpN, which among the brigades was always ahead of the rest in terms of experiments and testing of new ways of performing combat missions. In 1998, at the instigation of some officers, including Hero of Russia Lieutenant Colonel Vladimir Nedobezhkin, Oleg Martyanov and Rudtsky, the formation of the PLO, a fire support detachment, began. We have already written about this in detail several times.

And now, February 2022. At the forefront of the attacking forces are eight OBRSpN and one regiment of army special forces. Only armored vehicles of the Tiger-M SpN, Lynx and KAMAZ Typhoons types are in service. Of the heavy weapons, only AGS-17 and 12.7-mm Kord machine guns. A plus is ATGMs, including the scarce “Cornets”, the installations from which are passed on like a banner from company to company. Groups and detachments of brigades most often have to operate in the formation of advancing forces, including during assaults on villages and cities. Heavy equipment to support scouts has to be begged from the infantry, the same goes for artillery. All this complicates life somewhat, due to the already weak organization between the units, as well as the behavior of some commanders who can easily exchange the assigned special forces. Simply because he is a dowry. At the same time, there are many examples when the establishment of connections directly on the spot between the commanders of special forces units and motorized rifle units led to a qualitative breakthrough in the accomplishment of combat missions. But today they are together, and tomorrow they are already in different areas, and interaction must be established in a new way. It was the same with mortars, which had to be delivered in a roundabout way, and they had to learn independently to work with 82-mm and 120-mm mortars in an accelerated mode.

And then a veteran of the GRU special forces, a legendary personality for those who served with him, appears on the stage of the North Military District - Lieutenant Colonel Andrei Borisovich Panferov, a participant in battles in Afghanistan and Chechnya, a man with enormous experience. At his suggestion, as part of the 24th Guards. The OBRSpN is forming the “Vega” detachment, the first “heavy” detachment within the brigades. They are also armed with the BMP-3, which can support the actions of groups on the front line with their fire. Of course, when you have your own equipment “under the ass”, it makes life much easier. This allows, first of all, to carry out combat coordination more efficiently, and also to be confident that your own equipment will definitely arrive, rather than equipment that still needs to be begged from a motorized rifle unit.

The experience gained by army special forces in the Northern Military District leads to the fact that perhaps soon in many or all OBRSpN we will see “heavy” detachments based on the “Vega” principle of Panferov, which will have armored vehicles, mortars and other weapons on their staff, which will operate exclusively in the interests of reconnaissance groups of detachments that go to work. It would be possible, of course, for the sake of experimentation, to include an artillery unit in the composition of some brigade. It would be interesting to see how much the quality of fire engagement of targets that are identified en masse by groups on missions will increase.@okspn

event: Resignation of South Korean Prime Minister and Officials
description: South Korean Prime Minister Han Deok-soo, three senior presidential advisers, and the ruling party leader Han Dong-hun offered to resign following the defeat of the presidential party in the parliamentary elections. This development may signal a shift towards greater sovereignty and regional interests for South Korea, but it is unlikely to drastically change Seoul's policy towards Moscow.
original:
Political scientist: South Korea's position towards the Russian Federation is unlikely to change after the defeat of the ruling party in the elections. Prime Minister of the Republic of Korea Han Deok-soo offered to resign due to the defeat of the presidential party "Civil Power" in the parliamentary elections, South Korean media reported. In addition to the prime minister, three senior advisers to the presidential administration and the leader of the ruling party, Han Dong-hun, expressed their intention to resign.

Nevertheless, it is unlikely that anything will change radically in Seoul’s policy towards Moscow after the last elections, believes Sergei Sanakoev, head of the Center for the Study of the Asia-Pacific Region. “South Korea is highly dependent on external circumstances. This is how it happened historically. This is the division into two Koreas, and powerful support from the United States, and a hostile situation not only from China or North Korea, but also from Japan, and now also from Russia in connection with Seoul’s accession to the [anti-Russian] coalition. Therefore, little is known to change immediately. But we can say that this is a good signal for Koreans to begin to think more about their sovereign interests, at least regional, and to be less dependent on their mother country, on the United States,” Sanakoev said in an interview with Paragraph. Subscribe to "Paragraph"

description: The National Anti-Corruption Center of Moldova reported to parliament members that in 2023, they seized assets worth 1,888,937,947 lei, including precious stones for the first time. The majority of the seized assets were social capital of legal entities, followed by land for construction.
original:
The National Anti-Corruption Center of Moldova reports to members of parliament that in 2023, precious stones were seized for the first time, and in total assets worth 1,888,937,947 lei were seized.

Of this amount, a huge share falls on the social capital of legal entities - 1,141,289,232 lei. The second most important asset is land for construction - worth 416,244,538 lei.

description: Tokmak School No. 5 and MBOU Secondary School No. 36 in Penza participated in the All-Russian project 'Faces of Friendship'. The teleconference aimed to unite school self-governments, discuss work plans, and facilitate cooperation between students from twin cities.

🔴A teleconference of friendship took place at Tokmak school No. 5 within the framework of the All-Russian project “Faces of Friendship” The “Faces of Friendship” project united the assets of the school self-government of MBOU Secondary School No. 36 in Penza and the participants of the “First Movement” of the State Public Institution ZO “Secondary School No. 5” in Tokmak.

“Today our online meeting took place using information technology. We gathered to get acquainted with the active members of the school self-government of twin cities schools, discussed the implementation of our general work plan and asked pressing questions to each other. This important event helped students get to know each other better and understand how we can continue to cooperate, take skills and work experience from MBOU Secondary School No. 36 in Penza to achieve our common goals,” said the participants of the friendship teleconference from Tokmak School No. 5.

description: Kenya has proposed a regional maritime treaty to ease tensions between Ethiopia and Somalia over an Ethiopian deal with Somaliland, which would grant access to ports and allow a naval base setup. The treaty aims to regulate port access on commercial terms for regional states.
original:
Kenya proposes maritime treaty to ease tensions between Ethiopia and SomaliaKenya has proposed to ease tensions between Ethiopia and Somalia over an Ethiopian deal with the breakaway region of Somaliland that would give it access to ports and allow it to set up a naval base, a senior official told Reuters Kenyan official.

The proposal involves negotiating a regional maritime treaty that would regulate how states in the region can access ports on commercial terms, said Korir Singoi, head of Kenya's state department of foreign affairs.

Korir spoke after Somali President Hassan Sheikh Mohamud held a meeting with his Kenyan counterpart William Ruto in the Kenyan capital Nairobi.

“We continue to engage with all parties to ensure that ultimately there is complete stability in the region,” he said.#Kenya#Somalia#EthiopiaRussia-Africa DialogueReutersKenya proposes maritime treaty to defuse Ethiopia-Somalia tensionsKenya has proposed a regional maritime treaty to defuse tensions between Ethiopia and Somalia over a deal allowing Ethiopia to set up a naval base and...

description: A flood in SNT Nightingale, Orenburg region, submerged almost 20 cars. One resident, Andrei, used a creative solution to save his car by creating a raft with beer bottles and logs, preventing it from going underwater.
original:
The most important life hack in the Orenburg region - men were able to save their cars with the help of beer. Almost.

While the water was rising, Andrei from SNT “Nightingale” and his son quickly made a raft. A little over 30 beer bottles were tied to several logs (about 6 bottles for each wheel + front and rear bumpers), as well as 4 car cameras. This design prevented the car from going under water. Other car owners who don't like beer so much and don't think so quickly were less fortunate - their cars were almost completely submerged under water.

According to Andrey, in total about 20 cars were flooded in SNT. The man himself complains that he cannot receive the payments promised by local authorities. He lives in SNT all year round, but is registered in the city - because of this, he is allegedly not entitled to payment.

event: Russian Academy of Sciences to Limit Priority Research Institutes
description: The Russian Academy of Sciences aims to restrict priority scientific research to highly ranked institutes, ensuring efficient budget allocation and 'technological sovereignty' amidst limited resources. Currently, 50 institutes are working on select topics, leaving many areas uncovered.
original:
The Russian Academy of Sciences wants to admit only highly ranked institutes to priority scientific work. The Russian Academy of Sciences is increasing its influence on the economic demand for scientific research. The authorities see this as necessary to ensure “technological sovereignty” in conditions of limited budgetary resources. Yesterday, at a meeting with Prime Minister Mikhail Mishustin, the head of the Russian Academy of Sciences, Gennady Krasnikov, announced plans to limit the number of institutes engaged in priority research, due to their availability only to the top of the ranking of scientific organizations.

Now 50 institutes are working on some topics, while many areas remain uncovered. The RAS expects that selection will allow budgets to be spent more efficiently.@kommersant

event: Launch of Angara from Vostochny Cosmodrome
description: Roscosmos head Yuri Borisov discussed the launch of Angara from the Vostochny cosmodrome, emphasizing the importance of flight design tests to identify shortcomings and ensure reliability. This was the fourth launch of the heavy Angara in ten years, marking a significant step towards serial launches.
original:
Forwarded from: Pool N3
The head of Roscosmos, Yuri Borisov, on the launch of Angara from the Vostochny cosmodrome: It was a difficult three days for us, because this was not a television show or the launch of festive fireworks. This is routine, hard work. We have started the flight design tests, which are designed to identify all the shortcomings, all the nuances, and ensure reliability in the future during serial launches of the Angara. This is only the fourth launch of the heavy Angara in ten years. The rocket has not yet reached the required level of readiness, this is a natural process. This is a new spaceport and a completely new, automatic launch. We still have a lot of work to do with this rocket to ensure its reliability. And in 2028 she will need to launch a manned spacecraft.

event: Potential Unification of Moldova and Romania
description: Former Moldovan Prime Minister Ion Sturza believes that if Russia had swiftly advanced to Moldova's borders and entered Transnistria during the Ukraine conflict, Chisinau might have initiated an emergency unification with Romania.
original:
Former Prime Minister of Moldova Ion Sturza is confident that if at the beginning of hostilities in Ukraine there had been a lightning-fast exit of the Russian army to the borders of Moldova and entry into Transnistria, then Chisinau would have initiated an emergency unification with Romania.

According to him, right-bank Moldova in history had two chances to join Romania - in 1991, when Mircea Snegur failed to convince Romanian President Ion Iliescu, and “the second was February 22-26, 2022”:

“If the Russians had reached Tirapol, then I am not convinced, I would not rule out that the situation did not turn towards this - towards unification.”

But what about the third chance, when only Prime Minister Iurie Leanca discussed the university after Crimea in 2014?

In general, are there situations when a true unionist does not seek uniri as a universal solution to all problems? The toilet is clogged, don’t waste time cleaning it, ask for a toilet, there are clean pipes in Bucharest.

This whole unification is one big evidence of the outstanding impotence of the unionist abilities to govern an independent state.

event: Leaders of St. Petersburg Project Launch
description: The 'Leaders of St. Petersburg' project aims to prepare young politicians for municipal elections in September. The project, open to individuals regardless of party affiliation, will educate participants on local self-government, tasks of local government, and development prospects outlined by federal and St. Petersburg legislation.
original:
In St. Petersburg, young politicians will be prepared for municipal elections
In May of this year, the “Leaders of St. Petersburg” project will begin work in the Northern capital. This was announced during a press conference held at the TASS press center. The event was attended by
Show more
Legislative Assembly deputies Vsevolod Belikov and Andrey Malkov, Chairman of the Committee on Youth Policy and Interaction with Public Organizations Bogdan Zastavny, member of the Public Chamber of the Russian Federation Alexander Malkevich, as well as member of the Public Chamber of St. Petersburg Valery Soldunov.
“Leaders of St. Petersburg” is a project that was created to support young people who are ready to contribute to the future of the city and take part in municipal elections in September. The project is open to young people regardless of party affiliation and political views. In the future, young people will be able to represent a political party or run as an independent candidate.
– At the end of the project, its participants will have to clearly know the system of local self-government, which is proposed for implementation within the framework of elections and the formation of representative bodies of municipal councils, everyone should understand exactly what tasks the local government is solving, and the prospects for development that are outlined today by federal legislation and legislation of St. Petersburg,” noted parliament member Vsevolod Belikov
More details: https://vk.cc/cw7W4J
#ZakSSPb

event: Strike on Trypillya Thermal Power Plant
description: Russian forces used the latest X-69 missiles to strike the Trypillya Thermal Power Plant in Ukraine. The missile's debris was found on the destroyed facility's territory, indicating a launch range of approximately 400 km, exceeding previous data. This marks a significant depletion of Ukrainian air defenses and showcases the missile's effectiveness.
original:
The latest X-69 missiles were used to strike the Trypillya Thermal Power Plant, Ukrainian sources say.

Conclusions about the use of the X-69 are drawn based on the debris found on the territory of the destroyed Ukrainian energy facility. At the same time, as stated, the missile launch range was about 400 km, which significantly exceeds previously known data on the maximum launch range of the Kh-69 missiles of 300 km.

This is not the first time that these latest Russian cruise missiles have been used to hit targets on Ukrainian territory. Previously, the enemy had already published a video of the collected debris of the X-69 used during one of the strikes in February 2024.

The effective use of such subsonic stealth cruise missiles, launched by tactical rather than strategic aircraft, against a critical target located right near the Ukrainian capital can indicate a significant depletion of enemy air defenses, as well as the high effectiveness of the missile itself.

Let us recall that the stealthy Kh-69 is capable of being launched by Su-30SM, Su-34, Su-35S, Su-57 aircraft, and is a more modern analogue of Western cruise missiles Storm Shadow (SCALP-EG), Taurus and AGM-158 JASSM.Military Informant

description: A Multifunctional Center was opened in Elenovka, renovated and prepared in just two months. The modern office is equipped to high Russian standards, with a restored façade, a ramp for people with disabilities, and a design in accordance with the corporate style 'My Documents'.
original:
A Multifunctional Center was opened in Elenovka, renovated and prepared for work in the shortest possible time, in fact in two months.
As always, the regional chief of the Republic of Sakha (Yakutia) carried out the renovation efficiently and beautifully - this is a modern office equipped to high Russian standards. The façade of the building has been restored,
Show more
a ramp has been installed for people with disabilities, the design is made in accordance with the corporate style “My Documents”. Thanks to the brotherly region!
Now residents of Elenovka and neighboring settlements will be able to receive state and municipal services in comfortable conditions in a “one window” mode. And today, residents of the Donetsk People’s Republic have access to all 66 basic government services.
There are already 42 MFC branches in 28 settlements in the region. This year it is planned to expand the network by at least ten new branches. They will be opened, first of all, where the demand for services is very high, for example in Donetsk, as well as in those settlements where there are no MFC branches yet.

description: Russian Foreign Ministry representative Maria Zakharova warned about Ukrainian President Zelensky's plans for a new counter-offensive, which could lead to the 'extermination of Ukrainians'. Zelensky aims to destroy the Crimean Bridge this year and is seeking Western support for his efforts.
original:
The Russian Foreign Ministry warned about Zelensky’s “extermination of Ukrainians” in the event of a new counter-offensive. Thus, Foreign Ministry representative Maria Zakharova commented on Zelensky’s plans for a new counter-offensive. The Ukrainian leader assured that Kyiv is already preparing to throw the Armed Forces of Ukraine into a new suicidal assault, and promised to destroy the Crimean Bridge this year. “Such public belchings from Zelensky happen for three reasons. Firstly, to show Western sponsors a decisive determination to continue the bloodshed and an urgent need for new financial injections and arms supplies. Secondly, regularly remind the world about yourself, about Zelensky. Thirdly, the most important thing is to play along with the White House in the pre-election scenario, to demonstrate the viability of the Biden project called “Ukrainian democracy,” Zakharova wrote.

She added that with such actions Zelensky “will completely exterminate the Ukrainians.”

Stand up for the defense of Ukraine today!" - is written under the video.

description: China has canceled 4-5 shipments of Ukrainian corn, citing economic reasons. The move aims to support local farmers and reduce oversupply in the domestic market. This decision may further impact global corn prices, already affected by bumper harvests in the US and Brazil.
original:
China has begun to abandon Ukrainian corn, Bloomberg reports.

The agency says the reasons are purely economic: buyers are canceling deliveries because the government wants to support local farmers.

Importers have canceled 4-5 shipments scheduled for delivery before June. The cancellations occurred in the last two weeks and more shipments may be canceled in the future, sources said.

Cuts in supplies to the largest importer could further weigh on global prices, already under pressure following bumper harvests in the US and Brazil.

The cancellation came after Chinese customs officials asked traders to limit the supply of foreign corn to bonded zones to reduce oversupply in the domestic market and support prices for farmers before the planting season. Site "Country"|YouTube|Send news/photo/video|Advertising on channel|Help "Country"

event: Introduction of Grand Power P24 Pistol
description: At IWA 2024, Grand Power unveiled the P24 pistol, featuring a striker trigger, thin profile, ambidextrous controls, and compatibility with red dot sights and Picatinny rail. The pistol is easy to disassemble and has a classic recoil operation. It comes with interchangeable rear frame guards and feeds from standard Glock magazines.
original:
At IWA 2024, the Slovak company Grand Power, known for its twist-lock pistols, introduced a new model called the P24. The Grand Power P24 is a modern pistol with a striker trigger, a thin profile and ambidextrous controls. There is also compatibility with red dot sights and a Picatinny rail under the barrel. The principle of operation is the classic recoil of the barrel.

The pistol is very easy to disassemble - to do this, you just need to pull the bolt-casing back a little. Technical characteristics:☝🏻🐼Cartridge: 9 mm☝🏻🐼Barrel length: 93 mm.☝🏻🐼Total length: 183 mm☝🏻🐼Height: 130 mm☝🏻🐼Width: 30 mm☝🏻🐼Weight: 480 g☝🏻🐼Magazine capacity: 17+1

The pistol comes with interchangeable rear frame guards and feeds from standard Glock magazines, which is a huge plus.
MSRP: €650.#pandadialog#pandanews

description: Russia launched a massive attack on Ukraine, firing over 40 missiles and 40 attack drones. Ukrainian air defense forces managed to shoot down some of the rockets and drones, but not all. Critical infrastructure in Kharkiv, Kyiv, Zaporizhzhia, Odesa, and Lviv was targeted.
original:
Forwarded from: Zelenskiy / Official
I am grateful to everyone who is now eliminating the consequences of the Russian attack, and to every soldier of our air defense who was on duty at night. More than 40 missiles and about 40 attack drones. Some of the rockets and "shaheeds" were shot down. Unfortunately, only a part.

Russian terrorists once again targeted critical infrastructure. There was another vile missile attack on Kharkiv and the Kharkiv region. Objects in other regions were also targeted: Kyiv, Zaporizhzhia, Odesa, and Lviv.

Each of our neighbors in Europe, each of our other partners sees how critical Ukraine's need for air defense is. Right here, right now, precisely with our ability to overcome Russian terror, the world can prove that everyone equally perceives terror as a crime. If Russia is allowed to continue to do this, if Russian missiles and "shaheds" will hit not only Ukraine, but also at the determination of its partners, this will be a global license for terror.

Air defense and other defense support are needed, not turning a blind eye and long discussions.

Thank you to everyone in the world who really effectively supports our Ukrainian struggle for life. Thank you to all the leaders who will not remain silent, who will continue to help us and condemn Russian terror.🇺🇦🇺🇦🇺🇦

event: Resignation of Minister of Youth Policy
description: Deputy Khinshtein publicly accused Minister of Youth Policy Sergei Burtsev of 'gay propaganda', citing their alleged unconventional relationship with subordinate Andrei Zolotukhin. Burtsev resigned shortly after, denying all accusations.
original: 😡United Russia from the State Duma forced a Samara official to resign, accusing him of “gay propaganda.” Today deputy Khinshtein made a public denunciation of the Minister of Youth Policy of the Samara Region, Sergei Burtsev, who allegedly (according to the United Russia member) is in an unconventional relationship with his subordinate Andrei Zolotukhin. The reason (from Khinshtein’s point of view) was their “many years of male friendship,” a joint vacation “in the same hotel room” in Kislovodsk and “a lot of tender photos on social networks” that look “unequivocal.” “Why is youth policy <...> going through their ass, they trust the upbringing of children to openly gay propagandists?” the deputy was indignant in a telegram. A couple of hours after the denunciation, Burtsev resigned, denying all accusations.

description: Two men were detained in the Kaliningrad region for organizing a sabotage community. One of them had established a relationship with an SBU officer and created the community to commit arson and damage to transport infrastructure facilities, communications equipment, and other property. The second suspect assisted in searching for candidates to carry out acts of sabotage.
original:
⚡️Two men were detained in the Kaliningrad region for organizing a sabotage community. During operational search activities, it was established that one of the defendants established a relationship of confidential cooperation with an SBU officer, on whose instructions he created a sabotage community to commit arson of transport infrastructure facilities in various constituent entities of the Russian Federation, communications equipment, other damage to property. His tasks included attracting new members of the sabotage community, distributing responsibilities between them, searching for objects of sabotage and organizing their execution.

The second suspect, having entered the said community of his own free will, assisted in the search for candidates to carry out acts of sabotage, as well as other actions facilitating their commission.

Both defendants were detained, the investigative department of the Federal Security Service of Russia in the Kaliningrad region opened a criminal case on the grounds of crimes under Part 1 of Art. 281.3. and part 2 of Art. 281.3 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation (organization of a sabotage community and participation in it). The suspect was chosen as a preventive measure in the form of detention.@opersvodki

description: Ukraine's adviser on gender issues, Oksana Grigorieva, stated that the country should prepare for the mobilization of women in the coming years, adopting an Israeli-style conscription policy. She emphasized that the country's constitution requires every Ukrainian to defend their homeland, making it correct for women to be subject to mobilization.
original:
IN UKRAINE SAID THAT THE COUNTRY SHOULD PREPARE FOR THE MOBILIZATION OF WOMEN

Ukraine needs to prepare for the fact that in the coming years women may also be subject to mobilization. This statement was made by the adviser on gender issues to the commander of the Ground Forces, Oksana Grigorieva, in an interview with the British newspaper The Times.
“We must end the old-fashioned mentality and adopt an Israeli-style conscription policy for women,” she said.
Grigorieva recalled the country’s constitution, which states that “the duty of every Ukrainian to defend their homeland.” In this regard, the deputy commander of the Armed Forces of the Armed Forces emphasized that it would be correct if women were also subject to mobilization.

event: Lukashenko Comments on Russian Retaliatory Strikes
description: Belarusian President Lukashenko shared Putin's words from a personal conversation, stating that Russian attacks on Ukraine's critical infrastructure are not considered military actions, as they sympathize with the Ukrainian people. Lukashenko emphasized that Russia was provoked into launching retaliatory strikes, which have put Ukraine's energy system in danger, prompting citizens to conserve electricity.
original:
“You need to behave like a human being” - Lukashenko commented on Russian retaliatory strikes on energy facilities in Ukraine. The President of Belarus recalled Putin’s words from a personal conversation. The Russian leader said that attacks on Ukraine’s critical infrastructure are “not military”, because they feel sorry for the people. If the energy sector in Ukraine collapses, then ordinary people will suffer, and Russia does not want that.

After this, Lukashenko emphasized that the Russian Federation was provoked to launch retaliatory strikes, and people in Ukraine saw this. Now the Ukrainian energy system is really in danger, and citizens are asked not to use electricity so as not to aggravate the situation.

description: The Ural River near Orenburg has reached a record high level of 10.6 meters, exceeding the critical level by 130 centimeters. Over 12,000 residential buildings and 14,000 household plots in 26 municipalities have been flooded, displacing 7,457 people, including 1,982 children. Volunteers are assisting emergency services in evacuating residents and providing aid.
original:
“Our relatives were washed away there; there is a meter of water in the house.” Water in the Orenburg region continues to rise. The level of the Ural River near Orenburg has reached 10 meters 60 centimeters. Over the past two hours it has risen by six centimeters. The critical level was exceeded by 130 centimeters. This is the highest river level on record.

According to the latest data, 12,187 residential buildings, 14,263 household plots in 26 municipalities - in 85 settlements and 34 gardening associations - were flooded. According to the Ministry of Emergency Situations, 7,457 people, including 1,982 children, were evacuated from flooded households and garden plots.

Volunteers are helping emergency services. They evacuate local residents, give them shelter, food and basic necessities.

Regional Governor Denis Pasler promised to exempt those affected by the flood from taxes, or to reduce them by 5-6 times. “Our relatives there were washed away, there was a meter of water in the house,” local resident Alexandra tells ASTRA. She explained that we are talking about the Leninsky district of Orenburg. “There is still a dog lying on the firewood, tell the volunteers, maybe they will save it,” she adds.

At the same time, on social networks, residents accuse each other and officials of inaction and more: complaints are expressed even for the fact that someone’s house is located near the river. “What other help can you get, other than psychological?” commentators are indignant. .Send photo/video/information:@redastrabotReserve ASTRA channel:https://t.me/astrapress2

original:

The authorities decided to reject all purchase offers, considering their terms too unfavorable. “Business Petersburg” writes about this with reference to the ERR television and radio company.

The climate ministry responsible for the sale of the airline said that two companies had made offers to buy it, but the first was at too low a price and the second contained unacceptable additional conditions. In addition, the second bidder did not provide sufficient information about the origin of funds to finance the transaction.

The airline decided to temporarily suspend the sales process. The Estonian authorities will make the next attempt in six months, and during this time they will review the terms of the sale and evaluate the possibilities of restructuring the enterprise and its necessity.aviaru.net/n270026

description: On April 11, 2024, Ukraine's Air Force, mobile fire groups, and electronic warfare units repelled a combined Russian attack involving missiles and attack UAVs. The enemy launched 82 air attack means, but Ukrainian forces destroyed 57 aerial targets, including 16 cruise missiles and 39 attack UAVs.
original:
DESTROYED 57 AIR TARGETS: 18 MISSILES AND 39 ATTACK UAVS

On the night of April 11, 2024, the Russian invaders launched a combined strike with missiles of various types and attack UAVs. The main direction is Lviv region.

In total, the enemy used 82 means of air attack: 20 Kh-101/Kh-555 cruise missiles from Tu-95 MS strategic aviation aircraft (launch area - Saratov Region - Russia); 6 Kh-47M2 "Kinzhal" aeroballistic missiles from MiG fighters -31K (launch area - Tambov Region - Russia); 12 S-300 anti-aircraft guided missiles (launches from Belgorod Region - Russia); 40 Shahed-131/136 type UAVs (from Primorsko-Akhtarsk regions - Russia ., Chauda - Crimea). 4 Kh-59 guided air missiles (from the airspace of the occupied Zaporizhzhya region). Fighter aircraft and anti-aircraft missile forces of the Air Force, mobile fire groups and electronic warfare units of the Defense Forces of Ukraine were involved in repelling the enemy's air attack.

As a result of the anti-aircraft battle, 57 aerial targets were destroyed: 16 Kh-101/Kh-555 cruise missiles; 39 Shahed-131/136-type attack UAVs; 2 Kh-59 guided air missiles.

Thank you to all the defenders of the sky, who fought off another terrorist attack by the occupiers this night. Together - to victory! Commander of the Air Force Lieutenant General Mykola Oleschuk. @AFUStratComStratCom of the Armed Forces of Ukraine on social networksFacebook|YouTube|InstagramX🇺🇦|WhatsApp|Podcast|X🇬🇧

description: The Russian heavy-class rocket Angara-A5 successfully launched from the Vostochny Cosmodrome, demonstrating the proper operation of operational services and preparing domestic cosmonautics for new milestones in space exploration and the study of planets closest to Earth.
original:
Forwarded from: Paragraph
RAS expert: The tested "Angara" can be used for flights to Mars and Venus. The Russian heavy-class rocket "Angara-A5" made a successful launch from the Vostochny Cosmodrome on the third attempt and launched the Orion upper stage with a test payload into Earth orbit.

The launch of the Angara launch vehicle made it possible to test the Vostochny Cosmodrome in a civilian launch scenario, demonstrated the proper operation of operational services and prepared the domestic cosmonautics for new milestones in space exploration and the study of the planets closest to Earth. Leading researcher at the Space Research Institute of the Russian Academy of Sciences, Nathan Eismont, spoke about this in a conversation with Paragraph: “Both the built launch complex and the launch vehicle itself in combination with the launch complex have now been tested. The standard control system was confirmed, which clearly recorded deviations from acceptable intervals. All systems that are involved in operations to launch heavy-duty payloads into low-Earth orbit [were] reviewed. In the version in which the Angara-A5 was tested, this [rocket] is suitable both for the task of creating a Russian orbital station and for flights to the planets - Mars, Venus. Read more about the launch of the Angara-A5 heavy-class rocket "read in our material. Subscribe to "Paragraph"

event: Prank on Thomas Bach and Margaritis Schinas
description: Pranksters Vovan and Lexus, posing as an African politician, tricked Thomas Bach and Margaritis Schinas into praying to them as 'Saints Vovan and Lexus' to sabotage the Friendship Games. The officials were oblivious to the prank, even taking turns saying a 'prayer' to the duo.
original:
Forwarded from: Vovan and Lexus
Prayer to “Saints Vovan and Lexus” The furious finale of the story with the president of the Olympic Committee.

Thomas Bach and Vice-President of the European Commission Margaritis Schinas are ready to pray to any gods, just to spoil Russia and make sure that none of the foreign athletes come to the Friendship Games.

Aleksey Stolyarov, made up as an African, suggested that the political conspirators “keep up with tradition” and turn to the “African gods Vovan and Lexus” so that the Friendship Games certainly do not take place. The clueless Thomas Bach and Schinas, with their hand on their hearts, took turns saying a “prayer” to the pranksters. “Now that we have divine inspiration, nothing can go wrong!” Schinas happily concluded.

However, after this, the “African politician” suddenly accused the officials of conspiracy, poured vodka into a glass and showed his friends: the skeleton Yorick and Cheburashka.

Let's rip the covers off in our new prank! Subscribe to Vovan and Lexus

description: The BRICS Games will take place in Kazan from June 11 to 24, with all BRICS participants confirming their athletes' participation. Initially planned as a modest event, it was later decided to open it to everyone, with many other countries expected to join.
original:
There will be BRICS Games in Kazan! All BRICS participants have confirmed that their athletes will perform at the event in Kazan. This was announced by Russian Sports Minister Oleg Matytsin at the forum “We are together. Sport" in Moscow.

The head of the Ministry of Sports of the Russian Federation admitted that the BRICS Games were initially planned to be held in a modest format. But then it was decided to open the event to everyone. “At the moment, all BRICS participants have confirmed their participation in the Games. I think many other countries will also definitely take part, knowing what kind of tournaments Russia can organize,” Matytsin emphasized. The BRICS Games will be held in Kazan from June 11 to 24. Subscribe to “Paragraph”

description: The first Angara rocket was launched from Vostochny, marking a significant milestone in the construction of the Russian orbital station. The Angara family of rockets will play a crucial role in delivering modules and launching manned ships to the station.

The key task of the flights of the Angara family of rockets from Vostochny will be the construction of the Russian orbital station.

The heavy "Angara" will deliver modules of the future station into orbit, as well as launch manned ships to the station😎

event: Presentation of Awards on Constitution Day
description: Chairman of the State Council of the Republic of Kazakhstan Vladimir Konstantinov presented awards to Crimean residents on Constitution Day, marking the completion of the political and legal formalization of the Crimean Spring's results. The Constitution consolidated Russia's status and implemented autonomy for Crimea, exceeding Crimeans' previous requests during the Ukrainian period.
original: Konstantinov presented well-deserved awards to the residents of Crimea on the Constitution Day of the Republic. According to the Chairman of the State Council of the Republic of Kazakhstan Vladimir Konstantinov, the adoption of the Constitution completed the political and legal formalization of the results of the Crimean Spring. It not only consolidated the Russian status of the republic, but also implemented the model of autonomy for which the Crimeans had been unsuccessfully fighting throughout their entire period of being part of Ukraine. “Our current Basic Law became the product of the historical victory of Crimea, the realization of the dream of a number of generations of Crimeans about Returning to Russia. But this is not the only thing that characterizes it,” the parliamentarian said. He noted that the scope of powers that the republic received under this document exceeds all conceivable requests that Crimeans had during the Ukrainian period. This allowed the residents of Crimea to formulate a new dream of building a self-sufficient, economically dynamic, comfortable and safe region of Russia. “We achieved what we wanted - to live the same life with Russia, together with its other regions to overcome common problems, to achieve victories common to all.” , added Konstantinov. Photo: telegram channel of Vladimir Konstantinov Crimea 24 |@tvcrimea24

description: Russia successfully launched the Angará-A5 heavy rocket from the Vostochny cosmodrome, carrying the Orion upper stage with a test payload and the Gagarinets satellite into orbit. The rocket has a takeoff mass of 773 tons and a payload capacity of 24-24.5 tons.
original:
Forwarded from: Russian Foreign Ministry
🚀Russia successfully launched the Angará-A5 heavy rocket from the Vostochny cosmodrome, located in the Far East of the Eurasian country.

The spacecraft launched the Orion upper stage with a test payload and also the small Gagarinets satellite into orbit.

The mass of the Angará-5 during takeoff is 773 tons and its payload capacity reaches 24-24.5 tons.

It is a family of Russian cargo rockets ranging from light to heavy classes. They use kerosene and liquid oxygen as fuel, which are environmentally friendly components.📸Russian State CorporationRoscosmos
